  2625                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2626                                  
  2627                                  ;************************************************************************
  2628                                  ;*									*
  2629                                  ;*	Ensure A20 is enabled before jumping into code in HMA.		*
  2630                                  ;*	This code assumes that if Segment of Device request packet is	*
  2631                                  ;*	DOS DATA segment then the Device request came from DOS & that	*
  2632                                  ;*	A20 is already on.						*
  2633                                  ;*									*
  2634                                  ;************************************************************************
  2635                                  
  2636                                  cdev_entry:	; proc near		
  2637 00000743 2E803E[0D00]00          		cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2638 00000749 740D                    		jz	short ce_enter_codeseg
  2639                                  				; optimized for DOS in HMA
  2640 0000074B 50                      		push	ax
  2641 0000074C 2EA1[0300]              		mov	ax, [cs:DosDataSg]
  2642 00000750 2E3906[1400]            		cmp	[cs:ptrsav+2], ax
  2643 00000755 58                      		pop	ax
  2644 00000756 7505                    		jnz	short not_from_dos
  2645                                  				; jump is coded this way to fall thru
  2646                                  				; in 99.99% of the cases
  2647                                  ce_enter_codeseg:
  2648 00000758 2EFF2E[DE06]            		jmp	far [cs:cdev]			
  2649                                  		;jmp	dword ptr cs:cdev
  2650                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2651                                  
  2652                                  not_from_dos:				
  2653 0000075D E86200                  		call	EnsureA20On
  2654 00000760 EBF6                    		jmp	short ce_enter_codeseg
  2655                                  
  2656                                  ;************************************************************************
  2657                                  ;*									*
  2658                                  ;*	outchr - this is our int 29h handler. it writes the		*
  2659                                  ;*	   character in al on the display using int 10h ttywrite	*
  2660                                  ;*									*
  2661                                  ;************************************************************************
  2662                                  
  2663                                  outchr:					
  2664 00000762 50                      		push	ax		; int 29h handler
  2665 00000763 56                      		push	si
  2666 00000764 57                      		push	di
  2667 00000765 55                      		push	bp
  2668 00000766 53                      		push	bx
  2669 00000767 B40E                    		mov	ah, 0Eh
  2670 00000769 BB0700                  		mov	bx, 7
  2671 0000076C CD10                    		int	10h		; - VIDEO - WRITE CHARACTER AND	ADVANCE	CURSOR (TTY WRITE)
  2672                                  					; AL = character, BH = display page (alpha modes)
  2673                                  					; BL = foreground color	(graphics modes)
  2674 0000076E 5B                      		pop	bx
  2675 0000076F 5D                      		pop	bp
  2676 00000770 5F                      		pop	di
  2677 00000771 5E                      		pop	si
  2678 00000772 58                      		pop	ax
  2679 00000773 CF                      		iret
  2680                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2681                                  
  2682                                  ;************************************************************************
  2683                                  ;*									*
  2684                                  ;*	block13 - our int13 hooker					*
  2685                                  ;*									*
  2686                                  ;************************************************************************
  2687                                  
  2688                                  block13:				
  2689 00000774 2E803E[0D00]00          		cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2690 0000077A 7408                    		jz	short skipa20
  2691 0000077C E85400                  		call	IsA20Off	; A20 Off?
  2692 0000077F 7503                    		jnz	short skipa20
  2693 00000781 E84300                  		call	EnableA20	; assure a20 enabled
  2694                                  
  2695                                  skipa20:				
  2696 00000784 2E8C1E[1C00]            		mov	[cs:i13_ds], ds	; save caller's ds for call-through
  2697 00000789 9C                      		pushf			; fake interrupt
  2698 0000078A 2EFF1E[EA06]            		call	far [cs:i13x]
  2699                                  		;call	dword ptr cs:i13x
  2700                                  					; call through Bios_Code entry table
  2701 0000078F 2E8E1E[1C00]            		mov	ds, [cs:i13_ds]
  2702 00000794 CA0200                  		retf	2
  2703                                  
  2704                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  2705                                  
  2706                                  ; the int13 hook calls back here to call-through to the ROM
  2707                                  ; this is necessary because some people have extended their
  2708                                  ; ROM BIOSs to use ds as a parameter/result register and
  2709                                  ; our int13 hook relies heavily on ds to access Bios_Data
  2710                                  
  2711                                  call_orig13:	; proc far		
  2712 00000797 8E1E[1C00]              		mov	ds, [i13_ds]	; get caller's ds register
  2713 0000079B 9C                      		pushf			; simulate an int13
  2714 0000079C 2EFF1E[B400]            		call	far [cs:Orig13]
  2715                                  		;call	cs:Orig13
  2716 000007A1 2E8C1E[1C00]            		mov	[cs:i13_ds], ds
  2717 000007A6 0E                      		push	cs
  2718 000007A7 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore ds ->	Bios_Data before return
  2719                                  
  2720 000007A8 9C                      		pushf
  2721                                  		; 10/12/2022
  2722                                  		; ds = cs
  2723 000007A9 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; 16/10/2022
  2724                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2725 000007AE 7408                    		jz	short corig13_popf_retf
  2726 000007B0 E82000                  		call	IsA20Off
  2727 000007B3 7503                    		jnz	short corig13_popf_retf
  2728 000007B5 E80F00                  		call	EnableA20
  2729                                  corig13_popf_retf:			
  2730 000007B8 9D                      		popf
  2731 000007B9 CB                      		retf
  2732                                  
  2733                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2734                                  
  2735                                  ; BIOSDATA:07BBh (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  2736                                  ; BIOSDATA:07BBh (MSDOS 5.0, IO.SYS) ; 16/10/2022
  2737                                  
  2738 000007BA 9000FFFF                HiMem:		dd 0FFFF0090h		
  2739 000007BE 80000000                LoMem:		dd 80h
  2740                                  
  2741                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------			
  2742                                  
  2743                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2744                                  
  2745                                  
  2746                                  ;************************************************************************
  2747                                  ;*									*
  2748                                  ;*	EnsureA20On - ensure that a20 is enabled if we're running	*
  2749                                  ;*	  in the HMA before interrupt entry points into Bios_Code	*
  2750                                  ;*									*
  2751                                  ;************************************************************************
  2752                                  
  2753                                  EnsureA20On:	; proc near		
  2754 000007C2 E80E00                  		call	IsA20Off
  2755                                  		;jz	short EnableA20
  2756                                  		;retn
  2757                                  		; 18/12/2022
  2758 000007C5 750B                    		jnz	short A20On_retn	
  2759                                  
  2760                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2761                                  
  2762                                  
  2763                                  EnableA20:	; proc near		
  2764 000007C7 50                      		push	ax
  2765 000007C8 53                      		push	bx
  2766 000007C9 B405                    		mov	ah, 5	 ; local enable a20
  2767                                  		;call	cs:xms
  2768 000007CB 2EFF1E[0E00]            		call	far [cs:xms] ; 16/10/2022
  2769 000007D0 5B                      		pop	bx
  2770 000007D1 58                      		pop	ax
  2771                                  A20On_retn:	; 18/12/2022	
  2772 000007D2 C3                      		retn
  2773                                  
  2774                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2775                                  
  2776                                  
  2777                                  IsA20Off:	; proc near		
  2778 000007D3 1E                      		push	ds
  2779 000007D4 06                      		push	es
  2780 000007D5 51                      		push	cx
  2781 000007D6 56                      		push	si
  2782 000007D7 57                      		push	di
  2783 000007D8 2EC536[BA07]            		lds	si, [cs:HiMem]
  2784 000007DD 2EC43E[BE07]            		les	di, [cs:LoMem]
  2785 000007E2 B90800                  		mov	cx, 8
  2786 000007E5 F3A7                    		repe cmpsw
  2787 000007E7 5F                      		pop	di
  2788 000007E8 5E                      		pop	si
  2789 000007E9 59                      		pop	cx
  2790 000007EA 07                      		pop	es
  2791 000007EB 1F                      		pop	ds
  2792 000007EC C3                      		retn
  2793                                  
  2794                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2795                                  
  2796                                  DisableA20:
  2797 000007ED 50                      		push	ax
  2798 000007EE 53                      		push	bx
  2799 000007EF B406                    		mov	ah, 6		; local disable A20
  2800 000007F1 2EFF1E[0E00]            		call	far [cs:xms]
  2801                                  		;call	cs:xms
  2802 000007F6 5B                      		pop	bx
  2803 000007F7 58                      		pop	ax
  2804 000007F8 C3                      		retn
  2805                                  
  2806                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2807                                  
  2808                                  ;************************************************************************
  2809                                  ;*									*
  2810                                  ;*	int19 - bootstrap interrupt -- we must restore a bunch of the	*
  2811                                  ;*	  interrupt vectors before resuming the original int19 code	*
  2812                                  ;*									*
  2813                                  ;************************************************************************
  2814                                  
  2815                                  int19:					
  2816 000007F9 0E                      		push	cs
  2817 000007FA 1F                      		pop	ds
  2818 000007FB 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]	; 16/10/2022
  2819 000007FF B90500                  		mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  2820                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors
  2821 00000802 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors	; 19/10/2022
  2822                                  next_int:				
  2823 00000805 AC                      		lodsb			; get int number
  2824 00000806 98                      		cbw			; assume < 128
  2825 00000807 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  2826 00000809 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int *	4
  2827 0000080B 89C7                    		mov	di, ax
  2828 0000080D AD                      		lodsw
  2829 0000080E AB                      		stosw
  2830 0000080F AD                      		lodsw
  2831 00000810 AB                      		stosw			; install the saved vector
  2832 00000811 E2F2                    		loop	next_int
  2833 00000813 803E[4006]00            		cmp	byte [int19sem], 0 ; 19/10/2022
  2834 00000818 7422                    		jz	short doint19
  2835 0000081A BE[4106]                		mov	si, i19_lst	; stacks code has changed these hardware interrupt vectors
  2836                                  					; stkinit in sysinit1 will initialize int19oldxx values
  2837 0000081D B90E00                  		mov	cx, 14		; num_i19
  2838                                  
  2839                                  i19_restore_loop:			
  2840 00000820 AC                      		lodsb			; get interrupt	number
  2841 00000821 98                      		cbw			; assume < 128
  2842 00000822 89C7                    		mov	di, ax
  2843 00000824 AD                      		lodsw			; get original vector offset
  2844 00000825 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; save it
  2845 00000827 AD                      		lodsw
  2846 00000828 83FBFF                  		cmp	bx, 0FFFFh	; check	for 0ffffh (unlikely segment)
  2847 0000082B 740D                    		jz	short i19_restor_1 ; opt no need to check selector too
  2848 0000082D 83F8FF                  		cmp	ax, 0FFFFh	; opt 0ffffh is	unlikely offset
  2849 00000830 7408                    		jz	short i19_restor_1
  2850 00000832 01FF                    		add	di, di
  2851 00000834 01FF                    		add	di, di
  2852 00000836 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  2853 00000837 AB                      		stosw
  2854 00000838 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  2855 00000839 AB                      		stosw			; put the vector back
  2856                                  
  2857                                  i19_restor_1:				
  2858 0000083A E2E4                    		loop	i19_restore_loop
  2859                                  
  2860                                  doint19:				
  2861 0000083C 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; ; Is dos running from	HMA
  2862 00000841 7403                    		jz	short SkipVDisk
  2863 00000843 E83000                  		call	EraseVDiskHead	; Then erase our VDISK header at 1MB boundary
  2864                                  					; Some m/c's (AST 386 & HP QS/16 do not clear
  2865                                  					; the memory above 1MB during a	warm boot.
  2866                                  SkipVDisk:				
  2867 00000846 CD19                    		int	19h		; DISK BOOT
  2868                                  					; causes reboot	of disk	system
  2869

  2872                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2873                                  ;
  2874                                  ; procedure : int15
  2875                                  ;
  2876                                  ;		Int15 handler for recognizing ctrl-alt-del seq
  2877                                  ;		If it recognizes ctrl-alt-del and if DOS was
  2878                                  ;		is running high, it Erases the VDISK header
  2879                                  ;		present at 1MB boundary
  2880                                  ;
  2881                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2882                                  
  2883                                  ; 16/10/2022
  2884                                  ;DELKEY		equ	53h
  2885                                  ;ROMDATASEG	equ	40h
  2886                                  KBFLAG		equ	17h
  2887                                  ;CTRLSTATE	equ	04h
  2888                                  ;ALTSTATE	equ	08h
  2889                                  
  2890                                  Int15:		; proc near		
  2891                                  		;cmp	ax, 4F00h+DELKEY
  2892 00000848 3D534F                  		cmp	ax, 4F53h	; del keystroke ?
  2893 0000084B 7405                    		jz	short int15_1
  2894 0000084D 2EFF2E[0B01]            		jmp	far [cs:Old15]	; 16/10/2022
  2895                                  		;jmp	cs:Old15
  2896                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2897                                  
  2898                                  int15_1:				
  2899 00000852 1E                      		push	ds
  2900 00000853 50                      		push	ax
  2901 00000854 B84000                  		mov	ax, 40h		; ROMDATASEG
  2902 00000857 8ED8                    		mov	ds, ax
  2903                                  		;mov	al, ds:17h	; [KBFLAG]
  2904                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2905 00000859 A01700                  		mov	al, [KBFLAG]
  2906 0000085C 240C                    		and	al, 0Ch		; (CTRLSTATE | ALTSTATE)
  2907 0000085E 3C0C                    		cmp	al, 0Ch		; (CTRLSTATE | ALTSTATE)
  2908 00000860 750C                    		jnz	short int15_2
  2909 00000862 0E                      		push	cs
  2910 00000863 1F                      		pop	ds
  2911 00000864 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; is DOS running from HMA
  2912 00000869 7403                    		jz	short int15_2
  2913 0000086B E80800                  		call	EraseVDiskHead
  2914                                  int15_2:				
  2915 0000086E 58                      		pop	ax
  2916 0000086F 1F                      		pop	ds
  2917 00000870 F9                      		stc
  2918 00000871 2EFF2E[0B01]            		jmp	far [cs:Old15]	; 16/10/2022
  2919                                  		;jmp	cs:Old15
  2920                                  
  2921                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2922                                  
  2923                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2924                                  ;
  2925                                  ; procedure : EraseVDiskHead
  2926                                  ;
  2927                                  ;		Erases the VDisk Header present in the 1MB boundary
  2928                                  ;
  2929                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2930                                  
  2931                                  EraseVDiskHead:	; proc near		
  2932 00000876 50                      		push	ax
  2933 00000877 51                      		push	cx
  2934 00000878 57                      		push	di
  2935 00000879 06                      		push	es
  2936 0000087A E845FF                  		call	EnsureA20On
  2937 0000087D B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; HMA seg
  2938 00000880 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  2939 00000882 BF1000                  		mov	di, 10h		; point	to VDISK header
  2940 00000885 B91000                  		mov	cx, 10h		; size of vdisk	header
  2941 00000888 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  2942 0000088A F3AB                    		rep stosw		; clear	it
  2943 0000088C 07                      		pop	es
  2944 0000088D 5F                      		pop	di
  2945 0000088E 59                      		pop	cx
  2946 0000088F 58                      		pop	ax
  2947 00000890 C3                      		retn
  2948

  2950

  2992                                  ;SR; WIN386 support
  2993                                  
  2994                                  ; WIN386 instance data structure
  2995                                  ;
  2996                                  ; Here is a Win386 startup info structure which we set up and to which
  2997                                  ; we return a pointer when Win386 initializes.
  2998                                  
  2999 0000089A 0300                    Win386_SI:	db 3, 0			; SI_Version
  3000                                  					; Startup Info for Win386
  3001 0000089C 00000000                SI_Next:	dd 0			; pointer to next info structure
  3002 000008A0 00000000                		dd 0			; a field we don't need
  3003 000008A4 00000000                		dd 0			; another field	we don't need
  3004 000008A8 [AC08]                  SI_Instance:	dw Instance_Table
  3005 000008AA 7000                    		dw 70h	; Bios_Data	; far pointer to instance table
  3006                                  
  3007                                  ; This table gives Win386 the instance data in the BIOS and ROM-BIOS data
  3008                                  ; areas. Note that the address and size of the hardware stacks must
  3009                                  ; be calculated and inserted at boot time.
  3010                                  
  3011 000008AC 00005000                Instance_Table:	dw 0, 50h		; print	screen status...
  3012 000008B0 0200                    		dw 2			; ... 2	bytes
  3013 000008B2 0E005000                		dw 0Eh,	50h		; ROM Basic data...
  3014 000008B6 1400                    		dw 14h			; ... 14H bytes
  3015 000008B8 [0C00]                  		dw altah		; a con	device buffer...
  3016 000008BA 7000                    		dw 70h			; Bios_Data segment
  3017 000008BC 0100                    		dw 1			; ... 1 byte
  3018                                  
  3019                                  NextStack:
  3020                                  
  3021                                  ; NOTE:  If stacks are disabled by STACKS=0,0, the following
  3022                                  ;	instance items WILL NOT be filled in by SYSINIT.
  3023                                  ;	That's just fine as long as these are the last items
  3024                                  ;	in the instance list since the first item is initialized
  3025                                  ;	to 0000 at load time.
  3026                                  
  3027 000008BE 00000000                		dw 0, 0			; pointer to next stack	to be used...
  3028 000008C2 0200                    		dw 2			; ... 2 bytes
  3029 000008C4 00000000                IT_StackLoc:	dd 0			; location of hardware stacks
  3030 000008C8 0000                    IT_StackSize:	dw 0			; size of hardware stacks
  3031 000008CA 00000000                		dd 0			; terminate the	instance table
  3032                                  
  3033                                  					;SR;
  3034 000008CE 00                      IsWin386:	db 0			; Flag to indicate whether
  3035                                  					; Win386 is running or not
  3036                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3037                                  
  3038                                  ;This routine was originally in BIOS_CODE but this causes a lot of problems
  3039                                  ;when we call it including checking of A20. The code being only about 
  3040                                  ;30 bytes, we might as well put it in BIOS_DATA
  3041                                  
  3042                                  V86_Crit_SetFocus:			
  3043 000008CF 57                      		push	di
  3044 000008D0 06                      		push	es
  3045 000008D1 53                      		push	bx
  3046 000008D2 50                      		push	ax
  3047 000008D3 31FF                    		xor	di, di
  3048 000008D5 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
  3049 000008D7 BB1500                  		mov	bx, 15h		; Device ID of DOSMGR device
  3050 000008DA B88416                  		mov	ax, 1684h	; Get API entry	point
  3051 000008DD CD2F                    		int	2Fh		; - Multiplex -	MS WINDOWS - GET DEVICE	API ENTRY POINT
  3052                                  					; BX = virtual device (VxD) ID,	ES:DI =	0000h:0000h
  3053                                  					; Return: ES:DI	-> VxD API entry point,	or 0:0 if the VxD does not support an API
  3054 000008DF 8CC0                    		mov	ax, es
  3055 000008E1 09F8                    		or	ax, di
  3056 000008E3 740B                    		jz	short Skip	; Here,	es:di is address of API	routine.
  3057                                  					; Set up stack frame to	simulate a call.
  3058 000008E5 0E                      		push	cs
  3059                                  		;mov	ax, offset Skip
  3060 000008E6 B8[F008]                		mov	ax, Skip
  3061 000008E9 50                      		push	ax
  3062 000008EA 06                      		push	es
  3063 000008EB 57                      		push	di		; API far call address
  3064 000008EC B80100                  		mov	ax, 1		; SetFocus function number
  3065 000008EF CB                      		retf			; do the call
  3066                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3067                                  
  3068                                  Skip:					
  3069 000008F0 58                      		pop	ax
  3070 000008F1 5B                      		pop	bx
  3071 000008F2 07                      		pop	es
  3072 000008F3 5F                      		pop	di
  3073 000008F4 CB                      		retf
  3074                                  
  3075                                  ;End WIN386 support
  3076
