 13498                                  
 13499                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13500                                  ;
 13501                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13502                                  ;
 13503                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13504                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13505                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13506                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13507                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13508                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13509                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13510                                  ;
 13511                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13512                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13513                                  ;
 13514                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13515                                  
 13516                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13517                                  HMAPtr:
 13518 000013B8 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13519                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13520 000013BD 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13521                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13522 000013C1 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13523 000013C4 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13524 000013C6 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13525                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13526 000013CB 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13527 000013CD FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13528                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13529 000013D1 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13530                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13531                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13532 000013D5 C3                      		retn
 13533                                  
 13534                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13535                                  
 13536                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13537                                  
 13538                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13539                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13540                                  
 13541                                  move_sector:
 13542                                  
 13543                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13544                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13545                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13546                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13547                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13548                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13549                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13550                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13551                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13552                                  ;
 13553                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13554                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13555                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13556                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13557                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13558                                  
 13559 000013D6 FC                      		cld
 13560 000013D7 51                      		push	cx
 13561 000013D8 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13562 000013DB 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13563 000013DF 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13564 000013E1 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13565 000013E5 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13566 000013E7 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13567 000013E9 59                      		pop	cx
 13568 000013EA C3                      		retn
 13569                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13570                                  
 13571                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13572 000013EB D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13573 000013ED F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13574 000013EF 59                      		pop	cx
 13575 000013F0 C3                      		retn
 13576                                  
 13577                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13578                                  
 13579                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13580                                  
 13581                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13582                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13583                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13584                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13585                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13586                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13587                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13588                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13589                                  ;
 13590                                  ; input conditions:
 13591                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13592                                  ;
 13593                                  ; output:
 13594                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13595                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13596                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13597                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13598                                  
 13599                                  check_wrap:	
 13600 000013F1 50                      		push	ax
 13601 000013F2 53                      		push	bx
 13602 000013F3 06                      		push	es
 13603 000013F4 57                      		push	di
 13604 000013F5 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13605 000013F8 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13606                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13607 000013FA 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13608                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13609 000013FF 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13610 00001401 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13611 00001405 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13612 00001407 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13613 0000140A 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13614 0000140C 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13615 0000140E F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13616                                  
 13617                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13618                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13619                                  
 13620 00001410 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13621 00001412 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13622                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13623 00001414 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13624 00001415 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13625                                  					; if on	boundary
 13626                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13627                                  not_on_bound:				
 13628 00001417 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13629 0000141A 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13630 0000141C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13631 0000141E 40                      		inc	ax
 13632 0000141F 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13633 00001421 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13634 00001424 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13635                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13636 00001428 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13637 0000142A 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13638 0000142B 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13639 0000142D 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13640 00001431 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13641                                  
 13642                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13643                                  
 13644 00001433 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13645 00001435 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13646 00001437 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13647                                  
 13648                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13649                                  
 13650 00001439 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13651 0000143B 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13652 0000143D 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13653                                  no_head_bound:				
 13654 0000143E 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13655 00001440 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13656 00001441 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13657 00001443 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13658 00001445 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13659 00001447 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13660 0000144A B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13661 0000144C 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13662 0000144E D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13663 00001450 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13664 00001452 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13665 00001454 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13666 00001456 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13667 00001458 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13668                                  no_wrap:				
 13669 0000145A F8                      		clc
 13670 0000145B 5F                      		pop	di
 13671 0000145C 07                      		pop	es
 13672 0000145D 5B                      		pop	bx
 13673 0000145E 58                      		pop	ax
 13674 0000145F C3                      		retn
 13675                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13676                                  
 13677                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13678 00001460 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13679 00001462 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13680 00001464 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13681                                  
 13682                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13683                                  
 13684                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13685                                  
 13686                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13687                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13688                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13689                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13690                                  ;
 13691                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13692                                  
 13693                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13694                                  find_bds:	
 13695 00001466 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13696                                  fbds_1:					
 13697 0000146A 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13698 0000146E 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13699 00001470 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13700                                  					; go to next bds
 13701 00001473 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13702 00001476 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13703 00001478 F9                      		stc
 13704                                  fdbs_2:					
 13705 00001479 C3                      		retn
 13706                                  
 13707                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13708                                  
 13709                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13710                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13711                                  doint:
 13712                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13713 0000147A 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13714                                  					; get physical drive number
 13715                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13716                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13717                                  		
 13718 0000147D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13719 0000147F 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13720 00001481 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13721                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13722 00001483 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13723                                  					; get request code
 13724                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13725 00001486 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13726                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13727 00001489 9D                      		popf
 13728                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13729                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13730 0000148A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13731                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13732                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13733 0000148F 9C                      		pushf
 13734                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13735 00001490 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13736                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13737                                  dointdone:				
 13738 00001493 C3                      		retn
 13739                                  
 13740                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13741                                  
 13742                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13743                                  
 13744                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13745                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13746                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13747                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13748                                  ;
 13749                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13750                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13751                                  ;
 13752                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13753                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13754                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13755                                  
 13756                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13757                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13758                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13759                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13760                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13761                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13762                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13763                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13764                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13765                                  ;end struc
 13766                                  
 13767                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13768                                  
 13769                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13770                                  ;	ah = function
 13771                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13772                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13773                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13774                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13775                                  ;   output conditions:
 13776                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13777                                  
 13778                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13779                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13780                                  ;
 13781                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13782                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13783                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13784                                  
 13785                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13786                                  
 13787                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13788                                  
 13789 00001494 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13790                                  
 13791                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13792                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13793                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13794                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13795                                  
 13796                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13797                                  
 13798                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13799                                  
 13800                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13801                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13802                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13803                                  
 13804                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13805 00001498 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13806 0000149D 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13807 0000149F 53                      		push	bx
 13808 000014A0 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13809 000014A3 E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13810 000014A6 5B                      		pop	bx
 13811 000014A7 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13812                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13813                                  
 13814                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13815                                  
 13816                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13817                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13818                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13819                                  
 13820                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13821                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13822 000014A9 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13823 000014AB 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13824 000014AD 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13825 000014AE 51                      		push	cx
 13826 000014AF 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13827 000014B1 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13828 000014B3 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13829 000014B5 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13830 000014B9 59                      		pop	cx
 13831 000014BA 58                      		pop	ax
 13832 000014BB 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13833                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13834 000014BD 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13835 000014BE 06                      		push	es
 13836                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13837 000014BF 2EC41E[9414]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13838                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13839                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13840 000014C4 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13841 000014C6 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13842 000014C9 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13843                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13844                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13845 000014CD 07                      		pop	es
 13846 000014CE 5B                      		pop	bx
 13847 000014CF EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13848                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13849                                  
 13850                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13851                                  
 13852                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13853                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13854                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13855                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13856                                  
 13857                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13858 000014D1 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13859                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13860 000014D6 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13861 000014D8 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13862                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13863 000014DD 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13864                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13865 000014DF 50                      		push	ax
 13866 000014E0 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13867                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13868                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13869 000014E2 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13870                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13871                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13872 000014E7 58                      		pop	ax
 13873 000014E8 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13874                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13875                                  
 13876                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13877                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13878                                  
 13879                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13880                                  
 13881                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13882                                  
 13883                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13884                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13885                                  
 13886                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13887 000014EA 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13888                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13889                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13890 000014EB 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13891                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13892                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13893                                  
 13894                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13895                                  
 13896 000014F0 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13897 000014F3 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13898 000014F6 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13899                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13900                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13901 000014F8 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13902 000014FD 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13903                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13904                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13905                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13906 000014FF 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13907                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13908                                  		
 13909 00001504 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13910                                  		
 13911 00001505 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13912                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13913 0000150A 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13914                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13915                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13916 0000150C 9D                      		popf
 13917 0000150D 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13918                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13919 0000150F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13920 00001510 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13921                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13922                                  
 13923                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13924                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13925                                  ; a changeline error.
 13926                                  
 13927                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13928 00001513 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13929                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13930 00001515 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13931 00001518 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13932 0000151A 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13933 0000151C 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13934 0000151E 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13935 00001523 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13936                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13937                                  					; never	would
 13938 00001525 53                      		push	bx
 13939 00001526 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13940 00001529 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13941 0000152C 5B                      		pop	bx
 13942                                  int13b:					
 13943 0000152D F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13944 0000152E EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13945                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13946                                  
 13947                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13948                                  
 13949                                  goterr13:				
 13950 00001530 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13951 00001533 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13952                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13953 00001535 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13954 00001538 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13955 0000153A 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13956 0000153F 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13957                                  
 13958 00001541 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13959                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13960                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13961                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13962 00001546 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13963                                  
 13964 00001548 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13965                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13966                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13967 0000154A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13968                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13969                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13970 0000154F A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13971 00001552 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13972 00001554 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13973 00001556 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13974 00001558 53                      		push	bx
 13975 00001559 51                      		push	cx
 13976 0000155A 52                      		push	dx
 13977 0000155B A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13978                                  loop_ecc:				
 13979 0000155E B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13980                                  
 13981                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13982                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13983                                  ;
 13984                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13985                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13986                                  ; track.
 13987                                  ;
 13988                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13989                                  ; this request.
 13990                                  ;
 13991                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13992                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13993                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13994                                  ;
 13995 00001561 E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13996                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13997                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13998 00001564 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13999                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14000 00001569 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14001 0000156B 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14002 0000156E 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14003 00001570 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14004 00001573 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14005                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14006                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14007                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14008 00001575 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14009                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14010                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14011                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14012                                  ok11_op:				
 14013 00001577 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14014 0000157B 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14015 0000157D FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14016                                  					; add 200h to address
 14017 0000157F FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14018 00001581 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14019 00001583 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14020                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14021                                  
 14022                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14023                                  
 14024                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14025 00001585 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14026                                  ok11_exit:				
 14027 00001586 5A                      		pop	dx
 14028 00001587 59                      		pop	cx
 14029 00001588 5B                      		pop	bx
 14030 00001589 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14031                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14032                                  
 14033                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14034                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14035                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14036                                  
 14037                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14038 0000158B 06                      		push	es
 14039 0000158C 53                      		push	bx
 14040 0000158D BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14041 00001590 1E                      		push	ds
 14042 00001591 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14043 00001592 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14044                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14045                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14046 00001595 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14047                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14048 0000159A 5B                      		pop	bx
 14049 0000159B 07                      		pop	es
 14050 0000159C 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14051 0000159E 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14052 000015A1 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14053                                  
 14054                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14055                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14056                                  
 14057                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14058 000015A3 56                      		push	si
 14059 000015A4 57                      		push	di
 14060 000015A5 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14061 000015A7 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14062 000015AA E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 14063 000015AD 5F                      		pop	di
 14064 000015AE 5E                      		pop	si
 14065 000015AF EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14066                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14067                                  
 14068                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14069                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14070                                  
 14071                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14072 000015B1 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14073 000015B4 FB                      		sti
 14074 000015B5 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14075 000015B8 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14076                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14077                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14078 000015BA 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14079 000015BD 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14080 000015BF 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14081 000015C2 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14082 000015C4 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14083                                  
 14084                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14085                                  
 14086                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14087                                  
 14088 000015C6 52                      		push	dx
 14089 000015C7 51                      		push	cx
 14090 000015C8 53                      		push	bx
 14091 000015C9 50                      		push	ax
 14092 000015CA 55                      		push	bp
 14093 000015CB 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14094 000015CD 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14095 000015CF D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14096 000015D1 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14097 000015D3 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14098 000015D5 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14099 000015D7 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14100 000015D9 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14101                                  
 14102                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14103                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14104                                  
 14105 000015DD 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14106 000015DF E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14107                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14108                                  
 14109                                  no_skip_first:				
 14110 000015E2 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14111 000015E4 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14112 000015E6 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14113                                  
 14114                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14115                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14116                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14117                                  ;
 14118                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14119                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14120                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14121                                  ; in error.
 14122                                  
 14123 000015E8 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14124 000015EA 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14125                                  
 14126                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14127                                  
 14128 000015EC 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14129                                  					; set up head number
 14130 000015EF E888FE                  		call	doint
 14131 000015F2 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14132                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14133                                  
 14134                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14135 000015F5 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14136 000015F7 F9                      		stc
 14137 000015F8 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14138                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14139                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14140                                  
 14141                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14142                                  
 14143                                  intverify:				
 14144 000015FB 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14145 000015FC 53                      		push	bx
 14146 000015FD 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14147 000015FE 07                      		pop	es
 14148                                  dosimple:				
 14149 000015FF BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14150                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14151                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14152                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14153 00001602 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14154                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14155 00001607 5B                      		pop	bx
 14156 00001608 07                      		pop	es
 14157 00001609 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14158                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14159                                  
 14160                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14161                                  
 14162                                  intformat:				
 14163 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14164 0000160D 53                      		push	bx
 14165 0000160E 56                      		push	si
 14166 0000160F 57                      		push	di
 14167 00001610 1E                      		push	ds
 14168                                  
 14169                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14170                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14171                                  
 14172 00001611 06                      		push	es
 14173 00001612 1E                      		push	ds
 14174 00001613 07                      		pop	es
 14175 00001614 1F                      		pop	ds
 14176 00001615 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14177 00001617 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14178 0000161A E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14179 0000161D 1F                      		pop	ds
 14180 0000161E 5F                      		pop	di
 14181 0000161F 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14182 00001620 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14183                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14184                                  
 14185                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14186                                  ; the first block.
 14187                                  ;
 14188                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14189                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14190                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14191                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14192                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14193                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14194                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14195                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14196                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14197                                  
 14198                                  doblock:
 14199                                  
 14200                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14201                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14202                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14203                                  				
 14204 00001622 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14205                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14206 00001625 51                      		push	cx
 14207 00001626 06                      		push	es
 14208 00001627 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14209                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14210 00001628 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14211 0000162B 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14212                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14213 0000162F 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14214                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14215 00001634 5F                      		pop	di
 14216 00001635 07                      		pop	es
 14217 00001636 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14218 00001638 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14219 0000163A B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14220 0000163C 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14221                                  doblockflop:				
 14222 0000163E 59                      		pop	cx
 14223                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14224 0000163F 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14225 00001641 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14226 00001643 50                      		push	ax
 14227 00001644 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14228 00001646 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14229                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14230                                  
 14231                                  doblocklast:				
 14232 00001648 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14233 0000164A 50                      		push	ax
 14234                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14235 0000164B E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14236 0000164E 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14237 00001650 58                      		pop	ax
 14238 00001651 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14239                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14240 00001654 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14241 00001656 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14242 00001658 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14243 0000165A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14244 0000165C 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14245                                  					; then we are done already.
 14246 0000165E 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14247                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14248 00001660 E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14249 00001663 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14250                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14251                                  
 14252                                  bufferx:				
 14253 00001665 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14254                                  					; set up head number
 14255                                  buffer:					
 14256 00001668 53                      		push	bx
 14257 00001669 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14258 0000166C 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14259 0000166F 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14260                                  					
 14261                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14262                                  
 14263 00001671 06                      		push	es
 14264 00001672 1E                      		push	ds
 14265 00001673 56                      		push	si
 14266 00001674 57                      		push	di
 14267 00001675 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14268 00001676 06                      		push	es
 14269 00001677 1F                      		pop	ds
 14270 00001678 07                      		pop	es
 14271 00001679 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14272 0000167C 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14273 0000167D 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14274 0000167F E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14275 00001682 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14276                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14277 00001683 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14278 00001684 5E                      		pop	si
 14279 00001685 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14280                                  
 14281                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14282                                  
 14283 00001686 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14284                                  					; get drive number
 14285 00001688 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14286 0000168B E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14287                                  					;
 14288                                  					; ah is	function
 14289                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14290                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14291                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14292                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14293                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14294 0000168E E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14295 00001691 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14296 00001692 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14297 00001694 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14298                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14299                                  
 14300                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14301                                  
 14302                                  doread:					
 14303 00001696 06                      		push	es
 14304 00001697 53                      		push	bx
 14305 00001698 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14306 00001699 07                      		pop	es
 14307 0000169A BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14308 0000169D B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14309 0000169F 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14310                                  					; get drive number
 14311 000016A2 E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14312                                  					; ah = function
 14313                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14314                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14315                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14316 000016A5 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14317 000016A8 5B                      		pop	bx
 14318 000016A9 07                      		pop	es
 14319 000016AA 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14320 000016AC 56                      		push	si
 14321 000016AD 57                      		push	di
 14322 000016AE 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14323 000016B0 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14324 000016B3 E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 14325 000016B6 5F                      		pop	di
 14326 000016B7 5E                      		pop	si
 14327                                  
 14328                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14329                                  
 14330                                  dotail:					
 14331 000016B8 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14332 000016B9 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14333 000016BC 41                      		inc	cx
 14334 000016BD 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14335 000016C0 F8                      		clc
 14336 000016C1 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14337 000016C3 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14338                                  
 14339                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14340                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14341                                  
 14342 000016C5 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14343 000016C8 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14344 000016CB E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14345                                  
 14346                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14347                                  
 14348                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14349                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14350                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14351                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14352                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14353                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14354                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14355                                  
 14356                                  bad13:					
 14357 000016CE 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14358 000016D0 5D                      		pop	bp
 14359 000016D1 5B                      		pop	bx
 14360 000016D2 5B                      		pop	bx
 14361 000016D3 59                      		pop	cx
 14362 000016D4 5A                      		pop	dx
 14363 000016D5 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14364 000016D7 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14365                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14366                                  
 14367                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14368 000016DA E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14369                                  
 14370                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14371                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14372                                  		;db 	0
 14373                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14374                                  
 14375                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14392                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14393                                  
 14394                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14395                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14396                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14397                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14398                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14399                                  
 14400                                  install_bds:		
 14401 000016E9 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14402 000016EA BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14403                                  
 14404                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14405                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14406                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14407 000016ED C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14408                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14409 000016EF 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14410 000016F3 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14411                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14412 000016F6 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14413 000016F8 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14414 000016FA 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14415                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14416 000016FE 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14417 00001701 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14418                                  					; we don't own it
 14419 00001706 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14420                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14421 00001709 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14422 0000170C 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14423                                  next_bds:				
 14424 00001710 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14425                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14426 00001713 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14427 00001715 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14428                                  					; install bds
 14429 00001718 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14430 0000171A 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14431                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14432 0000171F 1F                      		pop	ds
 14433                                  
 14434                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14435                                  ;
 14436                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14437                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14438                                  ;
 14439                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14440                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14441                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14442                                  ;
 14443                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14444                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14445                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14446                                  
 14447 00001720 C3                      		retn

 14540                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------
