 19521                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19522                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19523                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19524                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19525                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19526                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19527                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19528                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19529                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19530                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19531                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19532                                  ;
 19533                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19534                                  
 19535                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19536                                  update_arena:
 19537 0000097F 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19538 00000980 57                      	push	di
 19539 00000981 51                      	push	cx
 19540 00000982 52                      	push	dx
 19541                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19542                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19543                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19544                                  	; ds = cs 
 19545 00000983 C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19546 00000987 4F                      	dec	di
 19547 00000988 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19548                                  						;  before sysvar
 19549 00000989 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19550                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19551 0000098B 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19552 00000990 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19553 00000992 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19554                                  
 19555                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19556 00000994 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19557 00000999 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19558 0000099B 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19559 0000099D 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19560 0000099F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19561                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19562 000009A1 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19563                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19564 000009A5 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19565 000009AB 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19566                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19567 000009AD 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19568 000009B1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19569                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19570                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19571 000009B3 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19572 000009B6 5A                      	pop	dx
 19573 000009B7 59                      	pop	cx
 19574 000009B8 5F                      	pop	di
 19575 000009B9 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19576 000009BA C3                      	retn
 19577                                  ;
 19578                                  ; M012 : END
 19579                                  ;

 19598                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19599                                  ;
 19600                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19601                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19602                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19603                                  ;
 19604                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19605                                  ;
 19606                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19607                                  
 19608                                  AllocHMA:
 19609                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19610                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19611                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19612                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19613                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19614                                  
 19615                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19616                                  ;
 19617                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19618                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19619                                  ;	push	ax
 19620                                  ;	popf
 19621                                  ;	pushf
 19622                                  ;	pop	ax
 19623                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)

 19627

 19629                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19630

 19643                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19644                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19645

 19655 000009E7 48                      	dec	ax
 19656 000009E8 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA

 19659

 19664                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K

 19675

 19677 000009FF 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19678

 19680 00000A04 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax

 19766                                  
 19767                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19768                                  ;
 19769                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19770                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19771                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19772                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19773                                  ;
 19774                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19775                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19776                                  ;
 19777                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19778                                  
 19779                                  StartVDHead:
 19780                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19781                                  
 19782 00000A3E 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19783 00000A42 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19784 00000A44 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19785 00000A46 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19786 00000A48 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19787                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19788 00000A49 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19789                                  VDiskSig1:
 19790 00000A50 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19791                                  
 19792                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19793                                  
 19794 00000A55 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19795                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19796 00000A5B 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19797 00000A6A 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19798 00000A6C 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19799                                  VDInt19:
 19800 00000A6D EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19801                                  OldVDInt19:
 19802 00000A6E 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19803                                  
 19804                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19805                                  
 19806                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19807 00000A72 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19808                                  VDiskSig2:
 19809 00000A75 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19810                                  
 19811                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19812                                  
 19813 00000A7A 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19814 00000A7D 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19815 00000A7F 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19816 00000A80 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19817 00000A82 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19818 00000A83 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19819 00000A85 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19820 00000A87 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19821 00000A88 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19822 00000A8A 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19823 00000A8C 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19824 00000A8E 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19825 00000A90 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19826                                  
 19827                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19828                                  
 19829                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19830                                  ;
 19831                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19832                                  ;
 19833                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19834                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19835                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19836                                  ;
 19837                                  ; Inputs : None
 19838                                  ;
 19839                                  ; Outputs : None
 19840                                  ;
 19841                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19842                                  ;
 19843                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19844                                  
 19845                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19846                                  
 19847                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19848 00000A92 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19849 00000A94 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19850                                  
 19851                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19852                                  
 19853                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19854 00000A96 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19855                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19856 00000A99 2EA3[6E0A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19857 00000A9D A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19858                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19859 00000AA0 2EA3[700A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19860                                  
 19861                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19862                                  
 19863 00000AA4 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19864                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19865                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19866 00000AA6 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19867 00000AA9 CD21                    	int	21h
 19868                                  
 19869                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19870                                  
 19871 00000AAB 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19872 00000AAC 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19873                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19874 00000AAE 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19875                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19876 00000AB5 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19877 00000ABC 40                      	inc	ax
 19878 00000ABD 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19879                                  
 19880                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19881                                  
 19882 00000ABF FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19883                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 19884 00000AC0 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 19885 00000AC6 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 19886                                  
 19887                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 19888                                  
 19889                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 19890 00000AC9 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 19891 00000ACC BE[3E0A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 19892 00000ACF 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 19893 00000AD1 0E                      	push	cs
 19894 00000AD2 1F                      	pop	ds
 19895 00000AD3 FC                      	cld
 19896 00000AD4 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 19897 00000AD6 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 19898                                  
 19899                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 19900                                  
 19901                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19902 00000AD7 57                      	push	di
 19903 00000AD8 06                      	push	es
 19904                                  
 19905 00000AD9 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19906 00000ADC 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19907 00000ADE BF1000                  	mov	di,10h

 19964                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19965                                  
 19966                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19967                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19968                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19969                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19970                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19971                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19972                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19973                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19974                                  ;								      ;I070
 19975                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19976                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19977                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19978                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19979                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19980                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19981                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19982                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19983                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19984                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19985                                  ;								      ;I070
 19986                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19987                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19988                                  
 19989                                  	; 12/12/2022

 20027                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20028                                  ;
 20029                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20030                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20031                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20032                                  ;		the offset.
 20033                                  ;

 20042 00000B69 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20043 00000B6B 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 20044 00000B6E 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20045 00000B71 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20046 00000B73 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20047 00000B75 29C7                    	sub	di,ax

 20055 00000B81 C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20056 00000B86 1F                      	pop	ds
 20057 00000B87 C3                      	retn

 20986                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20987                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20988                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20989                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20990                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20991                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20992                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20993                                  ;
 20994                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20995                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20996                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20997                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20998                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20999                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21000                                  ;
 21001                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21002                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21003                                  ;
 21004                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21005                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21006                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21007                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21008                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21009                                  ;
 21010                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21011                                  ;
 21012                                  ;			  none.
 21013                                  
 21014                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21015                                  ;
 21016                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21017                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21018                                  
 21019                                  	; 24/10/2022

 21220                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21221                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21222                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21223                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21224                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21225                                  ;
 21226                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21227                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21228                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21229                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21230                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21231                                  ; program).
 21232                                  
 21233                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21234                                  
 21235                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21236                                  
 21237 00001039 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21238                                  
 21239                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21240                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21241                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21242                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21243                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21244                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21245                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21246                                  ; carridge return.
 21247                                  
 21248                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21249                                  ;character after =.
 21250

 21252 0000103B 1E                      	push	ds
 21253 0000103C 07                      	pop	es
 21254 0000103D 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21255 0000103E 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21256                                  
 21257 00001040 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21258 00001042 FC                      	cld
 21259 00001043 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21260 00001049 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21261                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name

 21265 00001051 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21266                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21267 00001053 AC                      	lodsb
 21268 00001054 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21269 00001057 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21270 00001059 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21271 0000105B FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21272 0000105D 47                      	inc	di
 21273 0000105E EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21274                                  done_installparm:
 21275 00001060 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21276 00001065 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21277 00001068 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21278 0000106A 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21279                                  					; starts with cr.
 21280                                  install_seg_set:
 21281 00001070 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21282 00001077 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 21283

 21285                                  ;
 21286                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 21287                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 21288                                  ;

 21290                                  ;
 21291                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 21292                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 21293                                  ; 	was fixed.

 21314                                  
 21315                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 21316 0000107D 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 21317                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21318 00001081 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21319                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21320 00001085 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21321 00001089 E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 21322 0000108C 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum

 21370                                  
 21371                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21372                                  ;
 21373                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21374                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21375                                  ;
 21376                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21377                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21378                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21379                                  
 21380                                  ParaRound:
 21381 000010B9 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21382 000010BC D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21383 000010BE D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21384 000010C0 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21385 000010C2 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21386 000010C4 C3                      	retn

 21388                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21389                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21390                                  ;
 21391                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21392                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21393                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21394                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21395                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21396                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21397                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21398                                  ;
 21399                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21400                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21401                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21402                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21403                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21404                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21405                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21406                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21407                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21408                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21409                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21410                                  ;
 21411                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21412                                  
 21413                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21414                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21415                                  sysinit_base:				
 21416 000010C5 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21417 000010CA 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21418 000010CF CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21419 000010D1 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21420 000010D6 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21421 000010DB 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21422 000010DC 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21423 000010DD 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21424                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21425                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21426 000010DF E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21427 000010E2 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21428 000010E7 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21429                                  
 21430                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21431                                  
 21432 000010E9 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21433 000010EB 0E                      	push	cs
 21434 000010EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 21435 000010ED BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21436 000010F0 CD21                    	int	21h
 21437                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21438                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21439                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21440                                  _stall: 
 21441                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21442 000010F2 F4                      	hlt 
 21443                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21444                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21445 000010F3 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21446                                  
 21447                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21448 000010F5 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21449                                  
 21450                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21451                                  
 21452                                  sum_up:
 21453                                  
 21454                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21455                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21456                                  ;
 21457                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21458                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21459                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21460                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21461                                  ;
 21462                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21463                                  
 21464 000010FA 1E                      	push	ds
 21465                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21466                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21467 000010FB 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21468 000010FF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21469 00001101 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21470 00001103 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21471 00001105 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21472                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21473 0000110A D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21474 0000110C 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21475                                  sum1:
 21476 0000110E 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21477 00001110 46                      	inc	si
 21478 00001111 46                      	inc	si
 21479 00001112 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21480                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21481                                  sum_sys_code:
 21482                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21483 00001114 BE1411                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21484                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21485                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21486                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21487                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21488                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21489                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21490                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21491 00001117 B9[6039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21492 0000111A 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21493 0000111C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21494                                  sum2:
 21495 0000111E 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21496 00001121 46                      	inc	si
 21497 00001122 46                      	inc	si
 21498 00001123 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21499 00001125 1F                      	pop	ds
 21500 00001126 C3                      	retn
 21501                                  
 21502                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21503                                  
 21504                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21505                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21506 00001127 0000                    	dw	0
 21507                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)

 21523                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21524                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21525                                  ;
 21526                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21527                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21528                                  ;
 21529                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21530                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21531                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21532                                  ;
 21533                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21534                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21535                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 21538                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)

 21540                                  set_buffer:
 21541 00001146 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21542 00001148 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21543 0000114B 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21544 0000114D B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA

 21550 00001151 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es

 21552 00001154 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21553                                  
 21554 00001159 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21555 0000115B 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21556 00001160 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21557                                  
 21558                                  ;	for each buffer
 21559

 21566

 21596                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21597                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21598                                  ;
 21599                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21600                                  ;
 21601                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21602                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21603                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21604                                  
 21605                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21606                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21607 000011A0 53                      	push	bx
 21608 000011A1 52                      	push	dx
 21609 000011A2 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21610 000011A6 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21611                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21612 000011AB 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21613                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21614                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21615                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21616 000011AE 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21617 000011B0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21618 000011B2 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21619                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21620 000011B5 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21621 000011B7 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21622 000011BA 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21623 000011BC BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21624                                  	;zf=1
 21625                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21626                                  	;zf=1
 21627 000011BF 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21628                                  got_hma:
 21629 000011C4 5A                      	pop	dx
 21630 000011C5 5B                      	pop	bx
 21631 000011C6 C3                      	retn

 21642                                  ;out:
 21643                                  ;    above entries set.

 21648 000011CC 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21649 000011D0 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21650 000011D4 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 21651                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax

 21654 000011DC 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 21655                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21656 000011E2 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21657                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21658 000011E8 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 21659 000011EE C3                      	retn

 21661                                  ; ======================================================================
 21662                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21663                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21664                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21665                                  
 21666                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21667                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21668                                  ;
 21669                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21670                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21671                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21672                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21673                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21674                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21675                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21676                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21677                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21678                                  ;
 21679                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21680                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21681                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21682                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21683                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21684                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21685                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21686                                  ;	conditions:
 21687                                  ;
 21688                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21689                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21690                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21691                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21692                                  ;
 21693                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21694                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21695                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21696                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21697                                  ;
 21698                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21699                                  ;
 21700                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21701                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21702                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21703                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21704                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21705                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21706                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21707                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21708                                  ;
 21709                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21710                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21711                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21712                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21713                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21714                                  ;
 21715                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21716                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21717                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21718                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21719                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21720                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21721                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21722                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21723                                  ;
 21724                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21725                                  
 21726                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21727                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21728                                  
 21729                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21730                                  stackinit:
 21731 000011EF 50                      	push	ax
 21732 000011F0 1E                      	push	ds
 21733 000011F1 06                      	push	es
 21734 000011F2 53                      	push	bx
 21735 000011F3 51                      	push	cx
 21736 000011F4 52                      	push	dx
 21737 000011F5 57                      	push	di
 21738 000011F6 56                      	push	si
 21739 000011F7 55                      	push	bp
 21740                                  
 21741                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21742                                  
 21743                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21744                                  	; ds = cs
 21745 000011F8 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21746 000011FB 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21747                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21748                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21749                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21750 000011FD 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21751                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21752 00001201 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21753 00001204 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21754                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21755 00001208 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21756                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21757                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21758                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21759 0000120B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21760                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21761 0000120F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21762 00001211 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21763                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21764                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21765                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21766 00001214 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21767                                  
 21768                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21769                                  
 21770                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21771                                  
 21772                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21773                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21774                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21775 00001218 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21776                                  
 21777                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21778                                  
 21779 0000121D B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21780                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21781                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21782                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 21783 00001220 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21784 00001222 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21785 00001224 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21786 00001228 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21787 0000122A 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21788                                  
 21789                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21790                                  
 21791 0000122D 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21792 00001232 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21793 00001236 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21794 00001238 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21795 0000123A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21796 0000123C 06                      	push	es
 21797 0000123D 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21798                                  
 21799                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21800                                  
 21801 0000123E 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21802 00001242 FC                      	cld
 21803 00001243 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21804                                  
 21805 00001245 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21806                                  
 21807                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21808                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21809                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21810                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21811                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 21812                                  
 21813                                  buildloop:
 21814                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21815                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 21816                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21817 00001249 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free
 21818 0000124E 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 21819                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 21820 00001252 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax
 21821                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 21822 00001256 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 21823                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 21824 0000125A 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]
 21825 0000125E 26895E06                	mov	[es:bp+newsp],bx		; mov [es:bp+6],bx
 21826                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx
 21827 00001262 26892F                  	mov	[es:bx],bp
 21828 00001265 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 21829                                  
 21830 00001268 E2DF                    	loop	buildloop
 21831                                  
 21832 0000126A 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 21833 0000126D 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 21834 00001271 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 21835                                  
 21836 00001275 1E                      	push	ds
 21837 00001276 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 21838 00001279 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21839 0000127B 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ;convertible?
 21840 00001280 1F                      	pop	ds
 21841 00001281 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 21842                                  
 21843 00001283 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable convertible nmis
 21844 00001285 E672                    	out	72h,al
 21845                                  
 21846                                  skip_disablenmis:
 21847 00001287 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21848 00001289 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			;es - segid of vector table at 0
 21849                                  					;ds - relocated stack code segment
 21850 0000128B FA                      	cli
 21851                                  
 21852                                  	;irp	aa,<02,08,09,70>
 21853                                  	;
 21854                                  	;mov	si,aa&h*4		;pass where vector is to be adjusted
 21855                                  	;mov	di,offset int19old&aa	;we have to set old&aa for int19 handler too.

 22561                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22562                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22563                                  
 22564                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22565                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22566                                  
 22567                                  new_init_loop:
 22568                                  
 22569                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22570                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22571                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22572                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22573                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22574                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22575                                  
 22576 000013E4 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22577 000013E7 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22578 000013E9 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22579 000013ED 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22580                                  
 22581 000013F0 1E                      	push	ds
 22582                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22583                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22584                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22585 000013F1 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22586 000013F4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22587 000013F6 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22588 000013F9 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22589 000013FB 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22590 000013FF 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22591 00001402 1F                      	pop	ds
 22592                                  
 22593 00001403 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22594 00001406 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22595 0000140A C3                      	retn
 22596                                  
 22597                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22598                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22599                                  
 22600                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22601                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22602                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22603                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22604                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22605                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22606                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22607                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22608                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22609                                  
 22610                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22611                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22612                                  
 22613                                  setdevmark:
 22614                                  
 22615 0000140B 06                      	push	es
 22616 0000140C 51                      	push	cx
 22617                                  
 22618 0000140D 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22619 00001412 2E890E[2C14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22620 00001417 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22621                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22622                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22623 00001419 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22624 0000141D 41                      	inc	cx
 22625                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22626 0000141E 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22627                                  
 22628 00001423 59                      	pop	cx
 22629 00001424 07                      	pop	es
 22630 00001425 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22631 0000142A C3                      	retn

 22764                                  _$P_DBSP1	   equ	DB_SP_HI	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS blank

 22831                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22832                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22833                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22834                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22835                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22836                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22837                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22838                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22839                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22840                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22841                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22842                                  
 22843                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22844                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22845 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX

 22854                                  
 22855                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22856                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22857                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
