 22860                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22861                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22862                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22863                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22864                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22865                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22866                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22867                                  
 22868                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22869                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22870 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22871 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22872 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22873                                  endstruc
 22874                                  
 22875                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22876                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22877                                  ;
 22878                                  ;
 22879                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22880                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22881                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22882                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22883                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22884                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22885                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22886                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22887                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22888                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22889                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22890                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22891                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22892                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22893                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22894                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22895                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22896                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22897                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22898                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22899                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22900                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22901                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22902                                  ;	   :
 22903                                  ;
 22904                                  ;Note:
 22905                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22906                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22907                                  ;
 22908                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22909                                  ;
 22910                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22911                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22912                                  ;
 22913                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22914                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22915                                  ;
 22916                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22917                                  ;
 22918                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22919                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22920                                  ;
 22921                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22922                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22923                                  ;
 22924                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22925                                  ;
 22926                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22927                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22928                                  ;
 22929                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22930                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22931                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22932                                  ;
 22933                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22934                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22935                                  ;
 22936                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22937                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22938                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22939                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22940                                  
 22941                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22942                                  
 22943                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22944                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22945                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22946                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22947                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22948                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22949                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22950                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22951                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22952                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22953                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22954                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22955                                  
 22956                                  ;**** Function flags
 22957                                  
 22958                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22959                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22960                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22961                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22962                                  
 22963                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22964                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22965 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22966 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22967 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22968 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22969 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22970 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22971                                  endstruc
 22972                                  
 22973                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22974                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22975                                  ;
 22976                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22977                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22978                                  ;	     +-
 22979                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22980                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22981                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22982                                  ;	     |	:
 22983                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22984                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22985                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22986                                  ;	     |	:
 22987                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22988                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22989                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22990                                  ;	     +-	:
 22991                                  ;
 22992                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22993                                  ;
 22994                                  ;Note:
 22995                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22996                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22997                                  ;
 22998                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22999                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23000                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23001                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23002                                  
 23003                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23004                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23005                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23006                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23007                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23008                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23009                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23010                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23011                                  
 23012                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23013 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23014 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23015 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23016 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23017 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23018                                  endstruc
 23019                                  
 23020                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23021                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23022                                  ;
 23023                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23024                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23025                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23026                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23027                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23028                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23029                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23030                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23031                                  ;
 23032                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23033                                  ;
 23034                                  ;            +-
 23035                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23036                                  ;	    | or
 23037                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23038                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23039                                  ;	    | or
 23040                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23041                                  ;	    | or
 23042                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23043                                  ;	    | or
 23044                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23045                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23046                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23047                                  ;	    | or
 23048                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23049                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23050                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23051                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23052                                  ;	    +-
 23053                                  ;
 23054                                  ;
 23055                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23056                                  ;      list.
 23057                                  ;
 23058                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23059                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23060                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23061                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23062                                  
 23063                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23064                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 23065 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23066 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23067 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23068 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23069                                  endstruc

 23180                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 23184                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23185                                  ; SysParse;
 23186                                  ;
 23187                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23188                                  ;
 23189                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23190                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23191                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23192                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23193                                  ;
 23194                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23195                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23196                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23197                                  ;
 23198                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23199                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23200                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23201                                  ;
 23202                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23203                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23204                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23205                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23206                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23207                                  ;
 23208                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23209                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23210                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23211                                  ;
 23212                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23213                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23214                                  ;
 23215                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23216                                  ;
 23217                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23218                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23219                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23220                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23221                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23222                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23223                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23224                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23225                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23226                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23227                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23228                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23229                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23230                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23231                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23232                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23233                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23234                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23235                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23236                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23237                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23238                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23239                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23240                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23241                                  ;					  (tm13)

 23243                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23244                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23245                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23246                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23247                                  
 23248                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23249                                  
 23250                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23251                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23252                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23253                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23254                                  
 23255                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23256                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23257                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23258                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23259                                  ;
 23260                                  
 23261                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23262                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23263                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23264                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23265                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23266                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23267                                  
 23268                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23269                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23270                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23271                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23272                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23273                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23274                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23275                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23276                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23277                                  
 23278                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23279                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23280                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23281                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23282                                  ;	     segment.
 23283                                  
 23284                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 23285                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 23286                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 23287                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 23288                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 23289                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 23290                                  
 23291                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 23292                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro

 23301                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove

 23304                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 23305                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 23306                                  
 23307                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 23308                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as

 23311

 23389                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 23390                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 23391                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 23392                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 23393                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 23394                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
 23395

 23399 00001509 2EC706[D314]2B3E        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+4], '+>'
 23400 00001510 2EC706[D514]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='
 23401                                  ;ENDIFtHHH

 23809                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23810                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23811                                  ;
 23812                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23813                                  ;
 23814                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23815                                  ;	    AL = type
 23816                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23817                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23818                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23819                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23820                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,

 24202                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24203                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24204                                  ;
 24205                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24206                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24207                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24208                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24209                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24210                                  ;
 24211                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24212                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24213                                  ;
 24214                                  ; Output:    None
 24215                                  ;
 24216                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24217                                  ;
 24218                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24219                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24220                                  
 24221                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24222                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24223                                  
 24224                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24225 000018CF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24226 000018D0 2E800E[4114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24227 000018D6 2E8026[4114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24228 000018DC 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24229 000018DF 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24230 000018E1 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24231                                  
 24232 000018E3 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24233 000018E5 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24234                                  
 24235 000018E7 2E800E[4114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24236                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24237 000018ED 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24238                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24239 000018EE E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24240 000018F1 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24241 000018F2 C3                      	retn
 24242                                  
 24243                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24244                                  
 24245                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24246                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 24247 000018F3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24248 000018F4 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24249 000018F5 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24250 000018F6 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24251 000018F7 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 24252 000018F9 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 24253 000018FB 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 24254                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 24255 000018FC 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 24256 000018FF 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 24257 00001901 7442                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 24258                                  
 24259 00001903 E8F000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 24260 00001906 7239                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 24261                                  
 24262 00001908 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 24263 0000190A 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 24264 0000190C D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 24265 0000190E D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24266 00001910 E8D100                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24267 00001913 722C                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24268                                  
 24269 00001915 89D3                    	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 24270 00001917 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 24271 00001919 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 24272 0000191B D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24273 0000191D E8C400                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24274 00001920 721F                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24275                                  
 24276 00001922 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 24277 00001924 D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24278 00001926 E8BB00                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24279 00001929 7216                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24280                                  
 24281 0000192B 01DA                    	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 24282 0000192D 11C1                    	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 24283 0000192F E8B200                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24284 00001932 720D                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24285                                  
 24286 00001934 01EA                    	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 24287 00001936 83D100                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 24288 00001939 E8A800                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24289 0000193C 7203                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24290

 24454

 24456 000019EE C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24457                                  
 24458                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24459 000019EF 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,

 24461

 25050 00001C28 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25051 00001C29 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25052 00001C2A C3                      	retn
 25053                                  
 25054                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25055                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25056                                  ;
 25057                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25058                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25059                                  ;	    blanks.
 25060                                  ;
 25061                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25062                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25063                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25064                                  ;
 25065                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25066                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25067                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25068                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25069                                  
 25070                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 25071 00001C2B 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25072 00001C2C 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25073 00001C2D 2EC606[3B14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 25074                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 25075                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 25076 00001C33 2E8026[4114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 25077 00001C39 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 25078 00001C3B 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25079                                  
 25080 00001C3D 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 25081 00001C3F 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25082                                  
 25083 00001C41 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 25084 00001C43 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25085                                  
 25086                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25087                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 25088 00001C45 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 25089 00001C47 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25090                                  
 25091 00001C49 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 25092 00001C4C 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25093                                  
 25094 00001C4E B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 25095 00001C50 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 25096 00001C51 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 25097 00001C53 EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25098                                  
 25099                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 25100 00001C55 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 25101                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 25102 00001C5A 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25103                                  
 25104                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 25105 00001C5C 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 25106                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 25107 00001C5E 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 25108                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25109 00001C62 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 25110 00001C64 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 25111                                  
 25112 00001C66 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 25113                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 25114 00001C69 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25115 00001C6A 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 25116 00001C6D 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25117                                  
 25118 00001C6F E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 25119                                  
 25120                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 25121 00001C71 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 25122                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 25123                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 25124 00001C73 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25125 00001C74 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25126 00001C75 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25127                                  
 25128                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 25129 00001C76 2EA2[3B14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 25130 00001C7A 2EF606[4114]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 25131 00001C80 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 25132                                  
 25133 00001C82 2E800E[4114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 25134                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 25135                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 25136 00001C88 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 25137 00001C8A EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25138                                  
 25139                                  
 25140                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25141                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25142                                  ;
 25143                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25144                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25145                                  ;
 25146                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25147                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25148                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25149                                  ;
 25150                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25151                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25152                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25153                                  
 25154                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25155                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25156                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25157                                  ;
 25158                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25159                                  
 25160                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25161                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25162                                  
 25163                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25164                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25165 00001C8C 8D2E[4A14]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25166                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25167 00001C90 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25168 00001C92 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25169                                  
 25170                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25171 00001C94 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25172 00001C96 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25173                                  
 25174 00001C98 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25175                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25176                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25177 00001C99 C3                      	retn
 25178                                  
 25179                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25180                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25181                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25182                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25183                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25184                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25185                                  
 25186                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25187                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25188 00001C9A 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25189 00001C9C 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25190                                  
 25191 00001C9E 2E800E[4114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25192                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25193                                  
 25194                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25195                                  	; cf=0
 25196                                  	;retn
 25197                                  
 25198                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25199                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25200                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25201 00001CA4 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25202                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25203                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25204 00001CA5 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25205                                  
 25206                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25207                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25208                                  ;
 25209                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25210                                  ;
 25211                                  ;  Input:
 25212                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25213                                  ;
 25214                                  ;  Output:
 25215                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25216                                  ;
 25217                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25218                                  ;
 25219                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25220                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25221                                  
 25222                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25223 00001CA6 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25224 00001CA7 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25225 00001CA8 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25226                                  	
 25227 00001CA9 2E833E[3E14]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25228 00001CAF 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25229                                  
 25230 00001CB1 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25231 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25232 00001CB3 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25233 00001CB4 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25234 00001CB5 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25235 00001CB6 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25236 00001CB7 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25237 00001CB8 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25238 00001CBA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 25239 00001CBC B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25240 00001CBF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25241                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25242 00001CC1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25243 00001CC3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25244 00001CC5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25245 00001CC6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25246 00001CC7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25247 00001CC8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25248 00001CC9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25249 00001CCA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25250 00001CCB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25251 00001CCC 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25252                                  
 25253                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25254 00001CCE 2E8936[3C14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25255 00001CD3 2E891E[3E14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25256                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25257 00001CD8 2E8B36[3C14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25258 00001CDD 2E8E1E[3E14]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25259                                  
 25260                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25261 00001CE2 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25262 00001CE5 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25263                                  
 25264 00001CE7 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25265 00001CE9 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25266                                  
 25267 00001CEB 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25268 00001CEE 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25269                                  
 25270 00001CF0 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25271 00001CF1 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25272                                  
 25273                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25274 00001CF3 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25275 00001CF4 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25276                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25277 00001CF5 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25278                                  
 25279                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25280                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25281                                  	; cf=0
 25282                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25283                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25284 00001CF7 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25285 00001CF8 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25286 00001CF9 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25287 00001CFA C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25840                                  
 25841                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25842                                  
 25843                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25844                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25845                                  
 25846                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25847                                  ;
 25848                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25849                                  ;
 25850                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25851                                  ;
 25852                                  ;   Modification log:
 25853                                  ;
 25854                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25855                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25856                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25857                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25858                                  ;
 25859                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25860                                  ;
 25861                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25862                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25863                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25864                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25865                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25866                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25867                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25868                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25869                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25870                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25871                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25872                                  ;
 25873                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25874                                  
 25875                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25876                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25877                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25878                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25879                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25880                                  
 25881                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25882                                  
 25883                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25884                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25885                                  
 25886                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25887                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25888                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25889                                  
 25890                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25891                                  ;
 25892                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25893                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25894                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25895                                  ;	           line.
 25896                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25897                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25898                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25899                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25900                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25901                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25902                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25903                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25904                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25905                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25906                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25907                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25908                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25909                                  ;	           for details).
 25910                                  
 25911                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25912                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25913                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25914                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25915                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25916                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25917                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25918                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25919                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25920                                  
 25921                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25922                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25923                                  
 25924                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25925                                  
 25926                                  %endif
 25927                                  
 25928                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 25929                                  
 25930                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 25931                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 25932                                  
 25933                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25934                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 25935                                  
 25936                                  		;public	DevEntry
 25937                                  
 25938 00001EDE 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25939 00001EE0 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25940 00001EE2 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25941 00001EE4 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25942 00001EE8 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25943                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25944                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25945                                  ;
 25946 00001EEC 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25947 00001EED 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25948 00001EEF 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25949 00001EF1 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25950                                  ;
 25951 00001EF3 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 25952                                  ;
 25953 00001EF7 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 25954 00001EF9 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 25955                                  ;
 25956 00001EFB 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 25957                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 25958 00001EFC 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 25959                                  ;
 25960 00001EFE 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 25961 00001EFF 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 25962 00001F01 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 25963                                  ;

 26042                                  
 26043                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26044                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26045                                  ;;
 26046                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26047                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26048                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26049                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26050                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26051                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26052                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26053                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26054                                  ;;

 26056                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for

 26081                                  
 26082                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 26083                                  
 26084 00001F71 50                      	push	ax
 26085 00001F72 57                      	push	di
 26086 00001F73 51                      	push	cx

 26089 00001F78 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 26090 00001F7A F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 26091 00001F7C 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 26092

 26094

 26098                                  
 26099                                  puteol:
 26100 00001F7F B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 26101 00001F81 AA                      	stosb
 26102 00001F82 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 26103 00001F84 AA                      	stosb
 26104 00001F85 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 26105                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26106                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 26107                                  
 26108                                  	; 11/12/2022

 26111 00001F88 1F                      	pop	ds
 26112

 26114                                  
 26115 00001F8D 59                      	pop	cx
 26116 00001F8E 5F                      	pop	di
 26117 00001F8F 58                      	pop	ax
 26118                                  
 26119                                  	; 11/12/2022

 26128 00001F95 58                      	pop	ax
 26129 00001F96 9D                      	popf
 26130 00001F97 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 26131 00001F99 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax

 26133                                  conferr:

 26135 00001FA0 E8AC13                  	call	badfil
 26136                                  endconv:

 26140                                  ;
 26141                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 26142                                  ;
 26143                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
