 32462                                  ; 13/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32463                                  
 32464                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32465                                  ;
 32466                                  ;**	umb_coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 32467                                  ;
 32468                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 32469                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 32470                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 32471                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 32472                                  ;
 32473                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 32474                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 32475                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 32476                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 32477                                  ;	USES	cx, di, ds, es
 32478                                  ;
 32479                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32480                                  
 32481                                  umb_coalesce:
 32482                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32483                                  	; ds = cs
 32484 00002BA8 1E                      	push	ds ; *!
 32485                                  
 32486 00002BA9 31FF                    	xor	di, di
 32487                                  
 32488                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]
 32489                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32490 00002BAB 8E06[0A1F]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData]
 32491 00002BAF 268E068C00              	mov	es,[es:UMB_ARENA]	; es = UMB_HEAD
 32492                                  uc_nextfree:
 32493 00002BB4 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 32494 00002BB6 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 32495                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 32496 00002BB8 26393E0100              	cmp	[es:ARENA.OWNER],di	; Q: is current arena free
 32497 00002BBD 7407                    	je	short uc_again		; Y: try to coalesce with next block
 32498                                  					; N: get next arena
 32499 00002BBF E82100                  	call	get_next		; es, ax = next arena
 32500 00002BC2 72E2                    	jc	short uc_done	; *!
 32501 00002BC4 EBEE                    	jmp	short uc_nextfree
 32502                                  uc_again:
 32503 00002BC6 E81A00                  	call	get_next		; ES, AX <- next block
 32504 00002BC9 72DB                    	jc	short uc_done	; *!
 32505                                  uc_check:
 32506 00002BCB 26393E0100              	cmp     [es:ARENA.OWNER],di	; Q: is arena free
 32507 00002BD0 75E2                    	jne	short uc_nextfree	; N: get next free arena
 32508                                  					; Y: coalesce
 32509 00002BD2 268B0E0300              	mov     cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]      ; cx <- next block size
 32510 00002BD7 41                      	inc     cx                      ; cx <- cx + 1 (for header size)
 32511                                  	;add	[3],cx
 32512 00002BD8 010E0300                	add     [ARENA.SIZE],cx		; current size <- current size + cx
 32513 00002BDC 268A0D                  	mov     cl,[es:di]              ; move up signature
 32514 00002BDF 880D                    	mov     [di],cl
 32515 00002BE1 EBE3                    	jmp     short uc_again		; try again
 32516                                  
 32517                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32518                                  ;uc_done:
 32519                                  	;retn
 32520                                  
 32521                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32522                                  ;
 32523                                  ;**	get_next - Find Next item in Arena
 32524                                  ;
 32525                                  ;	ENTRY	dS - pointer to block head
 32526                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 32527                                  ;		'C' set if arena damaged
 32528                                  ;
 32529                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32530                                  
 32531                                  	; 01/11/2022
 32532                                  get_next:
 32533 00002BE3 803E00005A              	cmp	byte [0],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32534 00002BE8 740A                    	je	short gn_err
 32535                                  _get_next_:
 32536 00002BEA 8CD8                    	mov     ax,ds                   ; ax=current block
 32537 00002BEC 03060300                	add     ax,[ARENA.SIZE]		; ax=ax + current block length
 32538 00002BF0 40                      	inc     ax                      ; remember that header!
 32539 00002BF1 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 32540                                  	;clc
 32541                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32542                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32543                                  	; cf=0
 32544                                  	;clc
 32545 00002BF3 C3                      	retn
 32546                                  gn_err:
 32547 00002BF4 F9                      	stc
 32548                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 32549                                  lfu_err:	 ; cf=1
 32550 00002BF5 C3                      	retn
 32551                                  
 32552                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32553                                  ;
 32554                                  ; procedure : LinkFirstUMB
 32555                                  ;
 32556                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32557                                  
 32558                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32559                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F81h)
 32560                                  LinkFirstUMB:
 32561                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32562                                  	; ds = cs
 32563 00002BF6 E8D3FE                  	call	umb_allocate
 32564 00002BF9 72FA                    	jc	short lfu_err  ; ds = cs ; 31/12/2022
 32565                                  
 32566                                  ; bx = segment of allocated UMB
 32567                                  ; dx = size of UMB
 32568                                  
 32569                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32570                                  	; ds = cs
 32571                                  
 32572 00002BFB CD12                    	int	12h			; ax = size of memory
 32573 00002BFD B106                    	mov	cl,6
 32574 00002BFF D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl			; ax = size in paragraphs
 32575                                  
 32576 00002C01 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			; cx = size in paras
 32577 00002C03 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx			; ax = - size of unused block
 32578                                  
 32579 00002C05 F7D8                    	neg	ax
 32580                                  
 32581 00002C07 83E901                  	sub	cx,1			; cx = first umb_arena
 32582 00002C0A 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; es = first umb_arena
 32583                                  	
 32584 00002C0C 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 32585 00002C12 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; mark as system owned
 32586                                  					
 32587 00002C19 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax	
 32588 00002C1D 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; 4353h
 32589                                  
 32590                                  ; put in the arena for the first UMB
 32591                                  
 32592 00002C24 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx			; es has first free umb seg
 32593 00002C26 26C60600005A            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32594 00002C2C 26C70601000000          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],arena_owner_system ; 0	
 32595                                  					; mark as free 
 32596 00002C33 4A                      	dec	dx			; make room for arena
 32597 00002C34 2689160300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],dx	
 32598                                  
 32599                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]
 32600                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32601 00002C39 8E06[0A1F]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData] ; ds = cs
 32602 00002C3D BF8C00                  	mov	di,UMB_ARENA ; 8Ch
 32603 00002C40 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx		; initialize umb_head in DOS
 32604                                  					;  data segment with the arena
 32605                                  					;  just below Top of Mem
 32606                                  
 32607                                  ; we must now scan the arena chain and update the size of the last arena
 32608                                  
 32609 00002C43 BF2400                  	mov	di,DOS_ARENA ; 24h
 32610 00002C46 268E05                  	mov	es,[es:di]		; es = start arena
 32611 00002C49 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 32612                                  ;scan_next
 32613                                  ; 09/12/2022
 32614                                  scannext:
 32615 00002C4B 26803D5A                	cmp	byte [es:di],arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'

 32646                                  ; procedure : ShrinkUMB

 32666 00002C77 2B1E[ED1E]              	sub	bx,[DevUMBAddr]
 32667 00002C7B 8E06[ED1E]              	mov	es,[DevUMBAddr]
 32668

 32670 00002C82 CD21                    	int	21h
 32671                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 32672                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 32673                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs

 32720                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32721                                  ; SYSINIT2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 32722                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32723                                  ; 14/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32724                                  
 32725                                  ; Multiple configuration block support  Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 32726                                  ;
 32727                                  ; Summary:
 32728                                  ;
 32729                                  ;   The procedure "organize" crunches the in-memory copy of config.sys
 32730                                  ;   into lines delimited by CR/LF (sometimes no CR, but *always* an LF)
 32731                                  ;   with the leading "keyword=" replaced by single character codes (eg, B
 32732                                  ;   for BUFFERS, D for DEVICE, Z for any unrecognized keyword); see comtab
 32733                                  ;   and/or config.inc for the full list.
 32734                                  ;
 32735                                  ;   [blockname] and INCLUDE are the major syntactical additions for multi-
 32736                                  ;   configuration support. blockname is either MENU, which contains one
 32737                                  ;   or more MENUITEM lines, an optional MENUDEFAULT (which includes optional
 32738                                  ;   time-out), or any user-defined keyword, such as NETWORK, CD-ROM, etc.
 32739                                  ;   INCLUDE allows the current block to name another block for inclusion
 32740                                  ;   during the processing phase of CONFIG.SYS. An INCLUDE is only honored
 32741                                  ;   once, precluding nasty infinite-loop scenarios. If blocks are present
 32742                                  ;   without a MENU block, then only lines inside COMMON blocks are processed.
 32743                                  ;
 32744                                  ; Example:
 32745                                  ;
 32746                                  ;   [menu]
 32747                                  ;   menuitem=misc,Miscellaneous
 32748                                  ;   menuitem=network,Network Configuration
 32749                                  ;   menudefault=network,15
 32750                                  ;
 32751                                  ;   [network]
 32752                                  ;   include misc
 32753                                  ;   device=foo
 32754                                  ;
 32755                                  ;   [misc]
 32756                                  ;   device=bar
 32757                                  ;   include alternate
 32758                                  ;
 32759                                  ;   [alternate]
 32760                                  ;   device=tar
 32761                                  ;
 32762                                  ;
 32763                                  ;   When the menu is displayed
 32764                                  ;
 32765                                  ;    1. Miscellaneous
 32766                                  ;    2. Network Configuration
 32767                                  ;
 32768                                  ;   #2 is highlighted as the default option, and will be automatically
 32769                                  ;   selected after 15 seconds. It will invoke the following lines in the
 32770                                  ;   following order:
 32771                                  ;
 32772                                  ;       DEVICE=BAR
 32773                                  ;       DEVICE=TAR
 32774                                  ;       DEVICE=FOO
 32775                                  ;
 32776                                  
 32777                                  ;MULTI_CONFIG equ 1
 32778                                  
 32779                                  ; the following depend on the positions of the various letters in switchlist
 32780                                  
 32781                                  switchnum	equ 11111000b ; 0F8h	; which switches require number
 32782                                  
 32783                                  flagec35	equ 00000100b ; 4	; electrically compatible 3.5 inch disk drive
 32784                                  flagdrive	equ 00001000b ; 8 
 32785                                  flagcyln	equ 00010000b ; 16
 32786                                  flagseclim	equ 00100000b ; 32
 32787                                  flagheads	equ 01000000b ; 64
 32788                                  flagff		equ 10000000b ; 128
 32789                                  
 32790                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32791                                  ; 19/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32792                                  
 32793                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3E78h
 32794                                  
 32795                                  ; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32796                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3054h
 32797                                  
 32798 00002CBF 00                      insert_blank:	db 	0
 32799

 32908                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32909                                  ;
 32910                                  ; procedure : parseline
 32911                                  ;
 32912                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 32913                                  ;
 32914                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32915                                  
 32916                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32917                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 32918                                  
 32919                                  parseline:
 32920                                  	push	ds
 32921                                  
 32922                                  	push	cs
 32923                                  	pop	ds
 32924                                  
 32925                                  nextswtch:
 32926                                  	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 32927                                  	je	short done_line
 32928                                  	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 32929                                  	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 32930                                  
 32931                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 32932                                  
 32933                                  	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 32934                                  	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 32935                                  	cmp	al,'/'
 32936                                  	je	short getparm
 32937                                  	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 32938                                  	jmp	short exitpl
 32939                                  
 32940                                  getparm:
 32941                                  	call	check_switch
 32942                                  	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 32943                                  	jc	short swterr
 32944                                  getnext:
 32945                                  	call	getchr
 32946                                  	jc	short done_line
 32947                                  	jmp	short nextswtch
 32948                                  swterr:
 32949                                  	jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 32950                                  
 32951                                  done_line:
 32952                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32953                                  	test	byte [switches],flagdrive ; 8
 32954                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified
 32955                                  	jnz	short okay
 32956                                  	stc				; mark error no-drive-specified
 32957                                  	jmp	short exitpl
 32958                                  
 32959                                  okay:
 32960                                  	mov	ax,[switches]
 32961                                  	and	ax,0003h	    ; get flag bits for changeline and non-rem
 32962                                  	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],ax
 32963                                  	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES],0
 32964                                  	;clc			    ; everything is fine
 32965                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32966                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32967                                  	; cf=0
 32968                                  	;clc
 32969                                  	call	setdeviceparameters
 32970                                  exitpl:
 32971                                  	pop	ds
 32972                                  	retn
 32973                                  put_back:
 32974                                  	inc	word [count]		; one more char to scan
 32975                                  	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 32976                                  	jmp	short done_line
 32977                                  
 32978                                  %endif
 32979                                  
 32980                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32981                                  ;
 32982                                  ; procedure : check_switch
 32983                                  ;
 32984                                  ; processes a switch in the input. it ensures that the switch is valid, and
 32985                                  ; gets the number, if any required, following the switch. the switch and the
 32986                                  ; number *must* be separated by a colon. carry is set if there is any kind of
 32987                                  ; error.
 32988                                  ;
 32989                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32990                                  
 32991                                  check_switch:
 32992 00002D15 E817FA                  	call	getchr
 32993                                  	;jc	short err_check
 32994 00002D18 724E                    	jc	short err_chk
 32995 00002D1A 24DF                            and     al,0DFh                 ; convert it to upper case
 32996 00002D1C 3C41                    	cmp	al,'A'
 32997                                  	;jb	short err_check
 32998 00002D1E 7248                    	jb	short err_chk ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32999 00002D20 3C5A                    	cmp	al,'Z'
 33000 00002D22 7743                    	ja	short err_check
 33001                                  
 33002 00002D24 06                      	push	es
 33003                                  
 33004 00002D25 0E                      	push	cs
 33005 00002D26 07                      	pop	es
 33006                                  
 33007 00002D27 8A0E[9637]              	mov	cl,[switchlist]		; get number of valid switches
 33008 00002D2B B500                    	mov	ch,0
 33009 00002D2D BF[9737]                	mov	di,1+switchlist		; point to string of valid switches
 33010 00002D30 F2AE                    	repne	scasb
 33011                                  
 33012 00002D32 07                      	pop	es
 33013 00002D33 7532                    	jnz	short err_check
 33014                                  
 33015 00002D35 B80100                  	mov	ax,1
 33016 00002D38 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl			; set bit to indicate switch
 33017 00002D3A 8B1E[0337]              	mov	bx,[switches]		; get switches so far
 33018 00002D3E 09C3                    	or	bx,ax			; save this with other switches
 33019 00002D40 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 33020                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33021 00002D42 A8F8                    	test	al,switchnum ; 0F8h
 33022                                  	;test	ax,switchnum ; 0F8h	; test against switches that require number to follow
 33023 00002D44 741E                    	jz	short done_swtch
 33024                                  
 33025 00002D46 E8E6F9                  	call	getchr
 33026 00002D49 721A                    	jc	short err_swtch
 33027                                  
 33028 00002D4B 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'
 33029 00002D4D 7516                    	jne	short err_swtch
 33030                                  
 33031 00002D4F E8DDF9                  	call	getchr
 33032 00002D52 53                      	push	bx			; preserve switches
 33033                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33034                                  	;mov	byte [cs:sepchr],' '	; allow space separators
 33035                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33036                                  	; ds = cs
 33037 00002D53 C606[2A03]20            	mov	byte [sepchr],' '
 33038 00002D58 E8D803                  	call	getnum
 33039                                  	;mov	byte [cs:sepchr],0
 33040                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33041 00002D5B C606[2A03]00            	mov	byte [sepchr],0
 33042 00002D60 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore switches
 33043                                  
 33044                                  ; because getnum does not consider carriage-return or line-feed as ok, we do
 33045                                  ; not check for carry set here. if there is an error, it will be detected
 33046                                  ; further on (hopefully).
 33047                                  
 33048 00002D61 E80500                  	call	process_num
 33049                                  
 33050                                  done_swtch:
 33051                                  	;clc
 33052                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33053                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33054                                  	; cf=0
 33055                                  	;clc
 33056 00002D64 C3                      	retn
 33057                                  
 33058                                  err_swtch:
 33059 00002D65 31CB                    	xor	bx,cx			; remove this switch from the records
 33060                                  err_check:
 33061 00002D67 F9                      	stc
 33062                                  err_chk:
 33063 00002D68 C3                      	retn

 33065                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33066                                  ;
 33067                                  ; procedure : process_num
 33068                                  ;
 33069                                  ; this routine takes the switch just input, and the number following (if any),
 33070                                  ; and sets the value in the appropriate variable. if the number input is zero
 33071                                  ; then it does nothing - it assumes the default value that is present in the
 33072                                  ; variable at the beginning. zero is ok for form factor and drive, however.
 33073                                  ;
 33074                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33075                                  
 33076                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 33077                                  	; (SYSINIT:3156h)
 33078                                  process_num:
 33079 00002D69 850E[0337]              	test	[switches],cx		; if this switch has been done before,
 33080 00002D6D 752B                    	jnz	short done_ret		; ignore this one.
 33081                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33082 00002D6F F6C108                  	test	cl,flagdrive ; 8
 33083                                  	;test	cx,flagdrive ; 8

 33085 00002D74 A2[0237]                	mov	byte [drive],al

 33087                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 33088                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33089                                  	; cf=0

 33091                                  try_f:
 33092                                  	; 12/12/2022

 33094                                  	;test	cx,flagff ; 80h
 33095 00002D7B 7404                    	jz	short try_t
 33096                                  
 33097                                  ; ensure that we do not get bogus form factors that are not supported
 33098                                  
 33099                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+1],al
 33100 00002D7D A2[DB35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],al
 33101                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33102                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 33103                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33104                                  	; cf=0
 33105 00002D80 C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 33106                                  try_t:
 33107 00002D81 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 33108 00002D83 7415                    	jz	short done_ret		; if number entered was 0, assume default value
 33109                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33110 00002D85 F6C110                  	test	cl,flagcyln ; 10h
 33111                                  	;test	cx,flagcyln ; 10h
 33112 00002D88 7404                    	jz	short try_s
 33113

 33116                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33117                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 33118                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33119                                  	; cf=0
 33120 00002D8D C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 33121                                  try_s:
 33122                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33123 00002D8E F6C120                  	test	cl,flagseclim ; 20h
 33124                                  	;test	cx,flagseclim ; 20h
 33125 00002D91 7404                    	jz	short try_h
 33126 00002D93 A3[0037]                	mov	[slim],ax

 33151                                  ;
 33152                                  ; procedure : parseline
 33153                                  ;
 33154                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 33155                                  ;
 33156                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33157                                  
 33158                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 33159                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 33160                                  parseline:
 33161                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33162                                  	; ds = cs ; *
 33163                                  
 33164                                  	;push	ds ; *
 33165                                  
 33166                                  	;push	cs ; *
 33167                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 33168                                  
 33169                                  nextswtch:
 33170 00002D9B 3C0D                    	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 33171 00002D9D 741C                    	je	short done_line
 33172 00002D9F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 33173 00002DA1 7421                    	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 33174                                  
 33175                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 33176                                  
 33177 00002DA3 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 33178 00002DA5 760F                    	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 33179 00002DA7 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/'
 33180 00002DA9 7402                    	je	short getparm
 33181 00002DAB F9                      	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 33182                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 33183                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33184                                  swterr:
 33185 00002DAC C3                      	retn
 33186                                  
 33187                                  getparm:
 33188 00002DAD E865FF                  	call	check_switch
 33189 00002DB0 891E[0337]              	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 33190 00002DB4 72F6                    	jc	short swterr
 33191                                  getnext:
 33192 00002DB6 E876F9                  	call	getchr
 33193                                  	;jc	short done_line
 33194                                  	;jmp	short nextswtch
 33195                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33196 00002DB9 73E0                    	jnc	short nextswtch
 33197                                  ;swterr:
 33198                                  	;jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 33199                                  
 33200                                  done_line:
 33201                                  	; 12/12/2022

 33203                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified

 33206                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 33207                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33208 00002DC3 C3                      	retn
 33209                                  
 33210                                  ;exitpl:
 33211                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33212                                  	; ds = cs
 33213                                  	;;pop	ds ; *
 33214                                  	;retn
 33215                                  
 33216                                  put_back:

 33218 00002DC8 FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 33219 00002DCC EBED                    	jmp	short done_line
 33220

 33239                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33240                                  ;
 33241                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 33242                                  ;
 33243                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 33244                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 33245                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 33246                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 33247                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 33248                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 33249                                  ;
 33250                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 33251                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 33252                                  ;
 33253                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 33254                                  ;
 33255                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33256                                  
 33257                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33258                                  
 33259                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 33260                                  setdeviceparameters:
 33261                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33262                                  	; ds = cs
 33263                                  	
 33264 00002DDD 06                      	push	es
 33265                                  
 33266 00002DDE 0E                      	push	cs
 33267 00002DDF 07                      	pop	es
 33268                                  
 33269 00002DE0 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 33270 00002DE2 8A1E[DB35]              	mov	bl,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 33271 00002DE6 80FB00                  	cmp	bl,DEV_5INCH ; 0
 33272 00002DE9 7506                    	jne	short got_80
 33273                                  
 33274 00002DEB C706[DE35]2800          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 33275                                  							; 48 tpi=40 cyl
 33276                                  got_80:
 33277 00002DF1 D1E3                    	shl	bx,1			; get index into bpb table
 33278 00002DF3 8BB7[8237]              	mov	si,[bpbtable+bx]	; get address of bpb
 33279                                  
 33280                                  	;mov	di,deviceparameters+7	
 33281                                  	; 02/11/2022
 33282 00002DF7 BF[E135]                	mov	di,deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB ; es:di -> bpb
 33283 00002DFA B91F00                  	mov	cx,A_BPB.size ; 31
 33284 00002DFD FC                      	cld
 33285                                  	;repe	movsb
 33286                                  	; 02/11/2022
 33287 00002DFE F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 33288                                  
 33289 00002E00 07                      	pop	es
 33290                                  
 33291                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33292 00002E01 F606[0337]20            	test	byte [switches],flagseclim ; 20h
 33293                                  	;test	word [switches],flagseclim ; 20h
 33294 00002E06 7406                    	jz	short see_heads
 33295                                  
 33296 00002E08 A1[0037]                	mov	ax,[slim]
 33297                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+20],ax
 33298 00002E0B A3[EE35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],ax
 33299                                  
 33300                                  see_heads:
 33301                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33302 00002E0E F606[0337]40            	test	byte [switches],flagheads ; 40h
 33303                                  	;test	word [switches],flagheads ; 40h
 33304 00002E13 7406                    	jz	short heads_not_altered
 33305                                  
 33306 00002E15 A1[FE36]                	mov	ax,[hlim]
 33307                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+22],ax	
 33308 00002E18 A3[F035]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax
 33309                                  
 33310                                  heads_not_altered:
 33311                                  
 33312                                  ; set up correct media descriptor byte and sectors/cluster
 33313                                  ;   sectors/cluster is always 2 except for any one sided disk or 1.44M
 33314                                  
 33315                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+9],2
 33316                                  	; 02/11/2022
 33317                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],2
 33318                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33319 00002E1B B80200                  	mov	ax,2	
 33320 00002E1E A2[E335]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 2
 33321                                  
 33322 00002E21 B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 33323                                  
 33324                                  ;	preload the mediadescriptor from the bpb into bh for convenient access
 33325                                  
 33326                                  	;mov	bh,[deviceparameters+17]
 33327                                  	; 02/11/2022
 33328 00002E23 8A3E[EB35]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 33329                                  
 33330                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33331                                  	; ax = 2
 33332 00002E27 3906[F035]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 33333                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 33334 00002E2B 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediad ; just use default if heads>2
 33335                                  
 33336 00002E2D 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 33337                                  
 33338                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 33339                                  
 33340 00002E2F 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 33341                                  
 33342                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 33343                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 33344                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 33345                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 33346                                  
 33347                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 33348                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 33349                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 33350                                  
 33351 00002E31 833E[EE35]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 33352 00002E36 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 33353 00002E38 833E[DE35]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 33354 00002E3D 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 33355                                  
 33356                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 33357                                  
 33358 00002E3F EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 33359                                  
 33360                                  ;	check for 320K
 33361                                  
 33362                                  not_144m:
 33363 00002E41 833E[DE35]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 33364 00002E46 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 33365 00002E48 833E[EE35]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33366 00002E4D 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 33367                                  
 33368 00002E4F B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 33369 00002E51 EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 33370                                  
 33371                                  only_one_head:
 33372                                  
 33373                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 33374                                  
 33375 00002E53 803E[DB35]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 33376 00002E58 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 33377                                  
 33378                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 33379                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 33380                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 33381                                  
 33382 00002E5A B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 33383 00002E5C 833E[EE35]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33384                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33385 00002E61 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 33386                                  
 33387 00002E63 B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 33388                                  
 33389                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 33390                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 33391                                  
 33392                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 33393                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33394                                  	; ax = 2
 33395 00002E65 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 33396 00002E66 A2[E335]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 33397                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 33398                                  
 33399                                  got_correct_mediad:
 33400 00002E69 881E[EB35]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 33401                                  
 33402                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 33403                                  
 33404 00002E6D A1[DE35]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 33405 00002E70 F726[F035]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS]
 33406 00002E74 F726[EE35]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK]
 33407 00002E78 A3[E935]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS],ax
 33408 00002E7B F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 33409                                  
 33410 00002E7C C3                      	retn
 33411                                  
 33412                                  ;	M047 -- end rewritten routine

 33860                                  	;mov	[cs:org_count],di

 33883                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33884                                  ;
 33885                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 33886                                  ;
 33887                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 33888                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 33889                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 33890                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 33891                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 33892                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 33893                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 33894                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 33895                                  ;
 33896                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33897                                  
 33898                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33899                                  
 33900                                  skip_comment:
 33901 00003043 E3EE                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 33902                                  
 33903                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33904                                  	; ds = cs	
 33905                                  
 33906 00003045 803E[CC03]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 33907                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 33908 0000304A 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 33909                                  
 33910 0000304C 803E[CD03]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 33911                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 33912 00003051 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 33913                                  
 33914 00003053 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33915                                  	
 33916 00003056 3806[CE03]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 33917                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 33918 0000305A 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 33919                                  
 33920 0000305C 803E[CD03]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 33921                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 33922 00003061 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33923                                  
 33924 00003063 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 33925                                  	
 33926 00003067 3806[CF03]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 33927                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 33928 0000306B 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 33929                                  skip_cmmt:
 33930 0000306D E3C4                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 33931 0000306F 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33932 00003072 46                      	inc	si
 33933 00003073 49                      	dec	cx
 33934 00003074 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 33935 00003076 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33936                                  no_commt:
 33937 00003078 C3                      	retn
 33938                                  
 33939                                  ; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33940                                  %if 0
 33941                                  
 33942                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 33943                                  
 33944                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33945                                  ;
 33946                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 33947                                  ;
 33948                                  ;   INPUT
 33949                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 33950                                  ;
 33951                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33952                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 33953                                  ;
 33954                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33955                                  ;       All
 33956                                  ;
 33957                                  ;   HISTORY
 33958                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 33959                                  ;
 33960                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33961                                  
 33962                                  kbd_read:
 33963                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 33964                                          jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 33965                                  
 33966                                          push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 33967                                          sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 33968                                          mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 33969                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 33970                                  kbd_loop:
 33971                                          mov     ah,1            ;
 33972                                          int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 33973                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 33974                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33975                                          int     16h             ;
 33976                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33977                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 33978                                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 33979                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 33980                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33981                                  	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 33982                                  
 33983                                  	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?
 33984                                          jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 33985                                  kbd_loopdone:
 33986                                          pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 33987                                  kbd_nodelay:
 33988                                          sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 33989                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33990                                          int     16h             ;
 33991                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33992                                          jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 33993                                          inc     bx              ; yes
 33994                                          inc     bx
 33995                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 33996                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 33997                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 33998                                          mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 33999                                          int     16h             ;
 34000                                          jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 34001                                          or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 34002                                          jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 34003                                  
 34004                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 34005                                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 34006                                          je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 34007                                  	
 34008                                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 34009                                          jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 34010                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 34011                                          mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 34012                                          call    print
 34013                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 34014                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4           ;
 34015                                          jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 34016                                  kbd_notf5:
 34017                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 34018                                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 34019                                          je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 34020                                  
 34021                                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 34022                                          jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 34023                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 34024                                          mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 34025                                          call    print           ;
 34026                                          mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 34027                                          mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 34028                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 34029                                          mov     ah,0            ;
 34030                                          int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 34031                                          mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 34032                                          or      bx,bx           ;
 34033                                          jz	short kbd_clean	;
 34034                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 34035                                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 34036                                          jb	short kbd_exit	;
 34037                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 34038                                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 34039                                          stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 34040                                          retn			;
 34041                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 34042                                          clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 34043                                          retn			;
 34044                                  
 34045                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34046                                  ;
 34047                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 34048                                  ;
 34049                                  ;   INPUT
 34050                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 34051                                  ;
 34052                                  ;   OUTPUT
 34053                                  ;       None
 34054                                  ;
 34055                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 34056                                  ;       None
 34057                                  ;
 34058                                  ;   HISTORY
 34059                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 34060                                  ;
 34061                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34062                                  
 34063                                  set_numlock:
 34064                                          push    ax
 34065                                          push    ds
 34066                                          sub     ax,ax
 34067                                          mov     ds,ax
 34068                                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 34069                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 34070                                          jne	short not_off	; no
 34071                                          and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 34072                                          jmp     short set_done
 34073                                  not_off:
 34074                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 34075                                          stc
 34076                                          jne	short set_done	; no
 34077                                          or      byte [0417h],20h
 34078                                  set_done:
 34079                                          pop     ds
 34080                                          pop     ax
 34081                                          retn
 34082                                  
 34083                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34084                                  
 34085                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34086                                  ;
 34087                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 34088                                  ;
 34089                                  ;   INPUT
 34090                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 34091                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 34092                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 34093                                  ;
 34094                                  ;   OUTPUT
 34095                                  ;       Same as above;  the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 34096                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 34097                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 34098                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 34099                                  ;
 34100                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 34101                                  ;       All
 34102                                  ;
 34103                                  ;   NOTES
 34104                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 34105                                  ;
 34106                                  ;   HISTORY
 34107                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 34108                                  ;
 34109                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34110                                  
 34111                                  menu_check:
 34112                                  
 34113                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present;  if so, then
 34114                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 34115                                  
 34116                                          push    cx              ;
 34117                                          push    si              ;
 34118                                          sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 34119                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 34120                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 34121                                          jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 34122                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 34123                                          jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 34124                                          inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 34125                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 34126                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 34127                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 34128                                          jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 34129                                          or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 34130                                          jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 34131                                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 34132                                          mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 34133                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 34134                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 34135                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 34136                                          jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 34137                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 34138                                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 34139                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 34140                                          cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 34141                                          je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 34142                                          cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 34143                                          jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 34144                                          call    get_char        ;
 34145                                          and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 34146                                          cmp     al,[swit_n+1]
 34147                                          jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 34148                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 34149                                          jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 34150                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 34151                                          cmp     al,[swit_f+1]
 34152                                          jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 34153                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 34154                                          jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 34155                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 34156                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 34157                                          jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 34158                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 34159                                          pop     si              ;
 34160                                          pop     cx              ;
 34161                                  
 34162                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 34163                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 34164                                  
 34165                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 34166                                          jnz	short menu_search
 34167                                  ;
 34168                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 34169                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 34170                                  ;
 34171                                          call    kbd_read
 34172                                          jnc	short menu_search
 34173                                          jmp	menu_abort
 34174                                  
 34175                                  ;   Search for MENU block;  it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 34176                                  
 34177                                  menu_search:
 34178                                          sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 34179                                          mov     di,szMenu	;
 34180                                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 34181                                          jnc	short menu_found ;
 34182                                          mov     byte [szBoot],0
 34183                                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 34184                                  
 34185                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 34186                                  
 34187                                  menu_color:
 34188                                          push    cx              ;
 34189                                          push    dx              ;
 34190                                          mov     dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 34191                                          call    get_number	; get first number
 34192                                          and     bl,0Fh		; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 34193                                          mov     ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 34194                                          and     dl,0F0h         ;
 34195                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 34196                                          call    delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 34197                                          jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 34198                                          call    get_number	; get next number
 34199                                          and     bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 34200                                          mov     dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 34201                                          and     dl,0Fh		;
 34202                                          mov     cl,4            ;
 34203                                          shl     bl,cl           ;
 34204                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 34205                                  check_color:                    ;
 34206                                          cmp     ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 34207                                          jne	short set_color	; no
 34208                                          xor     dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 34209                                  set_color:
 34210                                          mov     [bMenuColor],dl ;
 34211                                          pop     dx              ;
 34212                                          pop     cx              ;
 34213                                          jmp	menu_nextitem
 34214                                  
 34215                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 34216                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 34217                                  
 34218                                  menu_found:
 34219                                          mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 34220                                          mov     word [offDefBlock],0
 34221                                          mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 34222                                          and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 34223                                  
 34224                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 34225                                          sub     dx,dx           ; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 34226                                  
 34227                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 34228                                  
 34229                                  menu_process:
 34230                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 34231                                          jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 34232                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 34233                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 34234                                          je	short to_menu_getdefault
 34235                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 34236                                          je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 34237                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 34238                                          je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 34239                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 34240                                          je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 34241                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 34242                                          je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 34243                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 34244                                          je	short menu_numlock ;
 34245                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 34246                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 34247                                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 34248                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 34249                                          stc                     ;
 34250                                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 34251                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34252                                  menu_numlock:
 34253                                          call    set_numlock
 34254                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34255                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 34256                                          jmp     short menu_getdefault
 34257                                  
 34258                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 34259                                  
 34260                                  menu_default:
 34261                                          mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 34262                                          cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 34263                                          jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 34264                                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 34265                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 34266                                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 34267                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 34268                                          mov     si,bx           ;
 34269                                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 34270                                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 34271                                          jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 34272                                          mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 34273                                  timeout_ok:                     ;
 34274                                          mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 34275                                  timeout_skip:
 34276                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34277                                  
 34278                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 34279                                  
 34280                                  menu_item:
 34281                                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 34282                                          jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 34283                                          mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 34284                                          call    srch_block      ;
 34285                                          je	short menu_itemfound ;
 34286                                          stc                     ;
 34287                                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 34288                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 34289                                  
 34290                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 34291                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 34292                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 34293                                  
 34294                                  menu_itemfound:
 34295                                          inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 34296                                          mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 34297                                          mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 34298                                          add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 34299                                  
 34300                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 34301                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 34302                                  ;   description...
 34303                                  
 34304                                          mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 34305                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 34306                                          mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 34307                                          call    skip_token      ;
 34308                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 34309                                          call    skip_delim      ;
 34310                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 34311                                          xchg    bx,di           ;
 34312                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 34313                                  
 34314                                  menu_nextitem:
 34315                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 34316                                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 34317                                  
 34318                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 34319                                  
 34320                                  menu_getdefault:
 34321                                          or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 34322                                          jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 34323                                          sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 34324                                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 34325                                  menu_valid:
